name: Judges 18:13
text: They passed there to the hill country of Ephraim, and came to the house of Micah.

name: Judges 18:14
text: Then the five men who went to spy out the country of Laish answered, and said to their brothers, "Do you know that there is in these houses an ephod, and teraphim, and an engraved image, and a molten image? Now therefore consider what you have to do."

name: Judges 18:15
text: They turned aside there, and came to the house of the young man the Levite, even to the house of Micah, and asked him of his welfare.

name: Judges 18:16
text: The six hundred men girt with their weapons of war, who were of the children of Dan, stood by the entrance of the gate.

name: Judges 18:17
text: The five men who went to spy out the land went up, and came in there, and took the engraved image, and the ephod, and the teraphim, and the molten image: and the priest stood by the entrance of the gate with the six hundred men girt with weapons of war.

name: Judges 18:18
text: When these went into Micah"s house, and fetched the engraved image, the ephod, and the teraphim, and the molten image, the priest said to them, "What are you doing?"

name: Judges 18:19
text: They said to him, "Hold your peace, put your hand on your mouth, and go with us, and be to us a father and a priest. Is it better for you to be priest to the house of one man, or to be priest to a tribe and a family in Israel?"

name: Judges 18:20
text: The priest"s heart was glad, and he took the ephod, and the teraphim, and the engraved image, and went in the midst of the people.

name: Judges 18:21
text: So they turned and departed, and put the little ones and the livestock and the goods before them.

name: Judges 18:22
text: When they were a good way from the house of Micah, the men who were in the houses near to Micah"s house were gathered together, and overtook the children of Dan.

name: Judges 18:23
text: They cried to the children of Dan. They turned their faces, and said to Micah, "What ails you, that you come with such a company?"

name: Judges 18:24
text: He said, "You have taken away my gods which I made, and the priest, and have gone away, and what more do I have? How then do you say to me, "What ails you?""

name: Judges 18:25
text: The children of Dan said to him, "Don"t let your voice be heard among us, lest angry fellows fall on you, and you lose your life, with the lives of your household."

name: Judges 18:26
text: The children of Dan went their way: and when Micah saw that they were too strong for him, he turned and went back to his house.

name: Judges 18:27
text: They took that which Micah had made, and the priest whom he had, and came to Laish, to a people quiet and secure, and struck them with the edge of the sword; and they burnt the city with fire.

name: Judges 18:28
text: There was no deliverer, because it was far from Sidon, and they had no dealings with any man; and it was in the valley that lies by Beth Rehob. They built the city, and lived therein.

name: Judges 18:29
text: They called the name of the city Dan, after the name of Dan their father, who was born to Israel: however the name of the city was Laish at the first.

name: Judges 18:30
text: The children of Dan set up for themselves the engraved image: and Jonathan, the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, he and his sons were priests to the tribe of the Danites until the day of the captivity of the land.

name: Judges 18:31
text: So they set them up Micah"s engraved image which he made, all the time that the house of God was in Shiloh.

name: Judges 19:1
text: It happened in those days, when there was no king in Israel, that there was a certain Levite living on the farther side of the hill country of Ephraim, who took to him a concubine out of Bethlehem Judah.

name: Judges 19:2
text: His concubine played the prostitute against him, and went away from him to her father"s house to Bethlehem Judah, and was there the space of four months.

name: Judges 19:3
text: Her husband arose, and went after her, to speak kindly to her, to bring her again, having his servant with him, and a couple of donkeys: and she brought him into her father"s house; and when the father of the young lady saw him, he rejoiced to meet him.

name: Judges 19:4
text: His father-in-law, the young lady"s father, retained him; and he stayed with him three days: so they ate and drink, and lodged there.

name: Judges 19:5
text: It happened on the fourth day, that they arose early in the morning, and he rose up to depart: and the young lady"s father said to his son-in-law, "Strengthen your heart with a morsel of bread, and afterward you shall go your way."

name: Judges 19:6
text: So they sat down, ate, and drank, both of them together: and the young lady"s father said to the man, "Please be pleased to stay all night, and let your heart be merry."

name: Judges 19:7
text: The man rose up to depart; but his father-in-law urged him, and he lodged there again.

name: Judges 19:8
text: He arose early in the morning on the fifth day to depart; and the young lady"s father said, "Please strengthen your heart and stay until the day declines;" and they both ate.

name: Judges 19:9
text: When the man rose up to depart, he, and his concubine, and his servant, his father-in-law, the young lady"s father, said to him, "Behold, now the day draws toward evening, please stay all night: behold, the day grows to an end, lodge here, that your heart may be merry; and tomorrow go on your way early, that you may go home."

name: Judges 19:10
text: But the man wouldn"t stay that night, but he rose up and departed, and came over against Jebus (the same is Jerusalem): and there were with him a couple of donkeys saddled; his concubine also was with him.

name: Judges 19:11
text: When they were by Jebus, the day was far spent; and the servant said to his master, "Please come and let us turn aside into this city of the Jebusites, and lodge in it."

name: Judges 19:12
text: His master said to him, "We won"t turn aside into the city of a foreigner, that is not of the children of Israel; but we will pass over to Gibeah."

name: Judges 19:13
text: He said to his servant, "Come and let us draw near to one of these places; and we will lodge in Gibeah, or in Ramah."

name: Judges 19:14
text: So they passed on and went their way; and the sun went down on them near to Gibeah, which belongs to Benjamin.

name: Judges 19:15
text: They turned aside there, to go in to lodge in Gibeah: and he went in, and sat him down in the street of the city; for there was no man who took them into his house to lodge.

name: Judges 19:16
text: Behold, there came an old man from his work out of the field at evening: now the man was of the hill country of Ephraim, and he lived in Gibeah; but the men of the place were Benjamites.

name: Judges 19:17
text: He lifted up his eyes, and saw the wayfaring man in the street of the city; and the old man said, "Where are you going? Where did you come from?"

name: Judges 19:18
text: He said to him, "We are passing from Bethlehem Judah to the farther side of the hill country of Ephraim. I am from there, and I went to Bethlehem Judah. I am going to the house of Yahweh; and there is no man who takes me into his house.

name: Judges 19:19
text: Yet there is both straw and provender for our donkeys; and there is bread and wine also for me, and for your handmaid, and for the young man who is with your servants: there is no want of anything."

name: Judges 19:20
text: The old man said, "Peace be to you; howsoever let all your wants lie on me; only don"t lodge in the street."

name: Judges 19:21
text: So he brought him into his house, and gave the donkeys fodder; and they washed their feet, and ate and drink.

name: Judges 19:22
text: As they were making their hearts merry, behold, the men of the city, certain base fellows, surrounded the house, beating at the door; and they spoke to the master of the house, the old man, saying, "Bring out the man who came into your house, that we may have sex with him!"

name: Judges 19:23
text: The man, the master of the house, went out to them, and said to them, "No, my brothers, please don"t act so wickedly; since this man has come into my house, don"t do this folly.

name: Judges 19:24
text: Behold, here is my virgin daughter and his concubine. I will bring them out now. Humble them, and do with them what seems good to you; but to this man don"t do any such folly."

name: Judges 19:25
text: But the men wouldn"t listen to him: so the man laid hold of his concubine, and brought her out to them; and they had sex with her, and abused her all night until the morning: and when the day began to dawn, they let her go.

name: Judges 19:26
text: Then came the woman in the dawning of the day, and fell down at the door of the man"s house where her lord was, until it was light.

name: Judges 19:27
text: Her lord rose up in the morning, and opened the doors of the house, and went out to go his way; and behold, the woman his concubine was fallen down at the door of the house, with her hands on the threshold.

name: Judges 19:28
text: He said to her, "Get up, and let us be going!" but no one answered. Then he took her up on the donkey; and the man rose up, and went to his place.

name: Judges 19:29
text: When he had come into his house, he took a knife, and laid hold on his concubine, and divided her, limb by limb, into twelve pieces, and sent her throughout all the borders of Israel.

name: Judges 19:30
text: It was so, that all who saw it said, "There was no such deed done nor seen from the day that the children of Israel came up out of the land of Egypt to this day! Consider it, take counsel, and speak."

name: Judges 20:1
text: Then all the children of Israel went out, and the congregation was assembled as one man, from Dan even to Beersheba, with the land of Gilead, to Yahweh at Mizpah.

name: Judges 20:2
text: The chiefs of all the people, even of all the tribes of Israel, presented themselves in the assembly of the people of God, four hundred thousand footmen who drew sword.

name: Judges 20:3
text: (Now the children of Benjamin heard that the children of Israel had gone up to Mizpah.) The children of Israel said, "Tell us, how did this wickedness happen?"

name: Judges 20:4
text: The Levite, the husband of the woman who was murdered, answered, "I came into Gibeah that belongs to Benjamin, I and my concubine, to lodge.

name: Judges 20:5
text: The men of Gibeah rose against me, and surrounded the house by night. They thought to have slain me, and they forced my concubine, and she is dead.

name: Judges 20:6
text: I took my concubine, and cut her in pieces, and sent her throughout all the country of the inheritance of Israel; for they have committed lewdness and folly in Israel.

name: Judges 20:7
text: Behold, you children of Israel, all of you, give here your advice and counsel."

name: Judges 20:8
text: All the people arose as one man, saying, "None of us will go to his tent, neither will any of us turn to his house.

name: Judges 20:9
text: But now this is the thing which we will do to Gibeah: we will go up against it by lot;

name: Judges 20:10
text: and we will take ten men of one hundred throughout all the tribes of Israel, and one hundred of one thousand, and a thousand out of ten thousand, to get food for the people, that they may do, when they come to Gibeah of Benjamin, according to all the folly that they have worked in Israel."

name: Judges 20:11
text: So all the men of Israel were gathered against the city, knit together as one man.

name: Judges 20:12
text: The tribes of Israel sent men through all the tribe of Benjamin, saying, "What wickedness is this that is happen among you?

name: Judges 20:13
text: Now therefore deliver up the men, the base fellows, who are in Gibeah, that we may put them to death, and put away evil from Israel." But Benjamin would not listen to the voice of their brothers the children of Israel.

name: Judges 20:14
text: The children of Benjamin gathered themselves together out of the cities to Gibeah, to go out to battle against the children of Israel.

name: Judges 20:15
text: The children of Benjamin were numbered on that day out of the cities twenty-six thousand men who drew the sword, besides the inhabitants of Gibeah, who were numbered seven hundred chosen men.

name: Judges 20:16
text: Among all this people there were seven hundred chosen men left-handed; everyone could sling stones at a hair-breadth, and not miss.

name: Judges 20:17
text: The men of Israel, besides Benjamin, were numbered four hundred thousand men who drew sword: all these were men of war.

name: Judges 20:18
text: The children of Israel arose, and went up to Bethel, and asked counsel of God; and they said, "Who shall go up for us first to battle against the children of Benjamin?" Yahweh said, "Judah first."

name: Judges 20:19
text: The children of Israel rose up in the morning, and encamped against Gibeah.

name: Judges 20:20
text: The men of Israel went out to battle against Benjamin; and the men of Israel set the battle in array against them at Gibeah.

name: Judges 20:21
text: The children of Benjamin came forth out of Gibeah, and destroyed down to the ground of the Israelites on that day twenty-two thousand men.

name: Judges 20:22
text: The people, the men of Israel, encouraged themselves, and set the battle again in array in the place where they set themselves in array the first day.

name: Judges 20:23
text: The children of Israel went up and wept before Yahweh until evening; and they asked of Yahweh, saying, "Shall I again draw near to battle against the children of Benjamin my brother?" Yahweh said, "Go up against him."

name: Judges 20:24
text: The children of Israel came near against the children of Benjamin the second day.

name: Judges 20:25
text: Benjamin went forth against them out of Gibeah the second day, and destroyed down to the ground of the children of Israel again eighteen thousand men; all these drew the sword.

name: Judges 20:26
text: Then all the children of Israel, and all the people, went up, and came to Bethel, and wept, and sat there before Yahweh, and fasted that day until evening; and they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before Yahweh.

name: Judges 20:27
text: The children of Israel asked of Yahweh (for the ark of the covenant of God was there in those days,

name: Judges 20:28
text: and Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, stood before it in those days), saying, "Shall I yet again go out to battle against the children of Benjamin my brother, or shall I cease?" Yahweh said, "Go up; for tomorrow I will deliver him into your hand."

name: Judges 20:29
text: Israel set ambushes all around Gibeah.

name: Judges 20:30
text: The children of Israel went up against the children of Benjamin on the third day, and set themselves in array against Gibeah, as at other times.

name: Judges 20:31
text: The children of Benjamin went out against the people, and were drawn away from the city; and they began to strike and kill of the people, as at other times, in the highways, of which one goes up to Bethel, and the other to Gibeah, in the field, about thirty men of Israel.

name: Judges 20:32
text: The children of Benjamin said, "They are struck down before us, as at the first." But the children of Israel said, "Let us flee, and draw them away from the city to the highways."

name: Judges 20:33
text: All the men of Israel rose up out of their place, and set themselves in array at Baal Tamar: and the ambushers of Israel broke forth out of their place, even out of Maareh Geba.

name: Judges 20:34
text: There came over against Gibeah ten thousand chosen men out of all Israel, and the battle was severe; but they didn"t know that evil was close on them.

name: Judges 20:35
text: Yahweh struck Benjamin before Israel; and the children of Israel destroyed of Benjamin that day twenty-five thousand one hundred men: all these drew the sword.

name: Judges 20:36
text: So the children of Benjamin saw that they were struck; for the men of Israel gave place to Benjamin, because they trusted the ambushers whom they had set against Gibeah.

name: Judges 20:37
text: The ambushers hurried, and rushed on Gibeah; and the ambushers drew themselves along, and struck all the city with the edge of the sword.

name: Judges 20:38
text: Now the appointed sign between the men of Israel and the ambushers was that they should make a great cloud of smoke rise up out of the city.

name: Judges 20:39
text: The men of Israel turned in the battle, and Benjamin began to strike and kill of the men of Israel about thirty persons; for they said, "Surely they are struck down before us, as in the first battle."

name: Judges 20:40
text: But when the cloud began to arise up out of the city in a pillar of smoke, the Benjamites looked behind them; and behold, the whole of the city went up in smoke to the sky.

name: Judges 20:41
text: The men of Israel turned, and the men of Benjamin were dismayed; for they saw that evil had come on them.

name: Judges 20:42
text: Therefore they turned their backs before the men of Israel to the way of the wilderness; but the battle followed hard after them; and those who came out of the cities destroyed them in its midst.

name: Judges 20:43
text: They surrounded the Benjamites, chased them, and trod them down at their resting place, as far as over against Gibeah toward the sunrise.

name: Judges 20:44
text: There fell of Benjamin eighteen thousand men; all these were men of valor.

name: Judges 20:45
text: They turned and fled toward the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon: and they gleaned of them in the highways five thousand men, and followed hard after them to Gidom, and struck of them two thousand men.

name: Judges 20:46
text: So that all who fell that day of Benjamin were twenty-five thousand men who drew the sword; all these were men of valor.

name: Judges 20:47
text: But six hundred men turned and fled toward the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon, and stayed in the rock of Rimmon four months.

name: Judges 20:48
text: The men of Israel turned again on the children of Benjamin, and struck them with the edge of the sword, both the entire city, and the livestock, and all that they found: moreover all the cities which they found they set on fire.

name: Judges 21:1
text: Now the men of Israel had sworn in Mizpah, saying, "There shall not any of us give his daughter to Benjamin as wife."

name: Judges 21:2
text: The people came to Bethel, and sat there until evening before God, and lifted up their voices, and wept severely.

name: Judges 21:3
text: They said, "Yahweh, the God of Israel, why has this happened in Israel, that there should be today one tribe lacking in Israel?"

name: Judges 21:4
text: It happened on the next day that the people rose early, and built there an altar, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings.

name: Judges 21:5
text: The children of Israel said, "Who is there among all the tribes of Israel who didn"t come up in the assembly to Yahweh?" For they had made a great oath concerning him who didn"t come up to Yahweh to Mizpah, saying, "He shall surely be put to death."

name: Judges 21:6
text: The children of Israel grieved for Benjamin their brother, and said, "There is one tribe cut off from Israel this day.

name: Judges 21:7
text: How shall we provide wives for those who remain, since we have sworn by Yahweh that we will not give them of our daughters to wives?"

name: Judges 21:8
text: They said, "What one is there of the tribes of Israel who didn"t come up to Yahweh to Mizpah?" Behold, there came none to the camp from Jabesh Gilead to the assembly.

name: Judges 21:9
text: For when the people were numbered, behold, there were none of the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead there.

name: Judges 21:10
text: The congregation sent there twelve thousand men of the most valiant, and commanded them, saying, "Go and strike the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead with the edge of the sword, with the women and the little ones.

name: Judges 21:11
text: This is the thing that you shall do: you shall utterly destroy every male, and every woman who has lain with a man."

name: Judges 21:12
text: They found among the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead four hundred young virgins, who had not known man by lying with him; and they brought them to the camp to Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan.

name: Judges 21:13
text: The whole congregation sent and spoke to the children of Benjamin who were in the rock of Rimmon, and proclaimed peace to them.

name: Judges 21:14
text: Benjamin returned at that time; and they gave them the women whom they had saved alive of the women of Jabesh Gilead: and yet so they weren"t enough for them.

name: Judges 21:15
text: The people grieved for Benjamin, because that Yahweh had made a breach in the tribes of Israel.

name: Judges 21:16
text: Then the elders of the congregation said, "How shall we provide wives for those who remain, since the women are destroyed out of Benjamin?"

name: Judges 21:17
text: They said, "There must be an inheritance for those who are escaped of Benjamin, that a tribe not be blotted out from Israel.

name: Judges 21:18
text: However we may not give them wives of our daughters, for the children of Israel had sworn, saying, "Cursed is he who gives a wife to Benjamin.""

name: Judges 21:19
text: They said, "Behold, there is a feast of Yahweh from year to year in Shiloh, which is on the north of Bethel, on the east side of the highway that goes up from Bethel to Shechem, and on the south of Lebonah."

name: Judges 21:20
text: They commanded the children of Benjamin, saying, "Go and lie in wait in the vineyards,

name: Judges 21:21
text: and see, and behold, if the daughters of Shiloh come out to dance in the dances, then come out of the vineyards, and each man catch his wife of the daughters of Shiloh, and go to the land of Benjamin.

name: Judges 21:22
text: It shall be, when their fathers or their brothers come to complain to us, that we will say to them, "Grant them graciously to us, because we didn"t take for each man his wife in battle, neither did you give them to them, otherwise you would now be guilty.""

name: Judges 21:23
text: The children of Benjamin did so, and took them wives, according to their number, of those who danced, whom they carried off. They went and returned to their inheritance, built the cities, and lived in them.

name: Judges 21:24
text: The children of Israel departed there at that time, every man to his tribe and to his family, and they went out from there every man to his inheritance.

name: Judges 21:25
text: In those days there was no king in Israel: every man did that which was right in his own eyes.

name: Ruth 1:1
text: It happened in the days when the judges judged, that there was a famine in the land. A certain man of Bethlehem Judah went to live in the country of Moab, he, and his wife, and his two sons.

name: Ruth 1:2
text: The name of the man was Elimelech, and the name of his wife Naomi, and the name of his two sons Mahlon and Chilion, Ephrathites of Bethlehem Judah. They came into the country of Moab, and continued there.

name: Ruth 1:3
text: Elimelech, Naomi"s husband, died; and she was left, and her two sons.

name: Ruth 1:4
text: They took them wives of the women of Moab; the name of the one was Orpah, and the name of the other Ruth: and they lived there about ten years.

name: Ruth 1:5
text: Mahlon and Chilion both died, and the woman was bereaved of her two children and of her husband.

name: Ruth 1:6
text: Then she arose with her daughters-in-law, that she might return from the country of Moab: for she had heard in the country of Moab how that Yahweh had visited his people in giving them bread.

name: Ruth 1:7
text: She went forth out of the place where she was, and her two daughters-in-law with her; and they went on the way to return to the land of Judah.

name: Ruth 1:8
text: Naomi said to her two daughters-in-law, "Go, return each of you to her mother"s house: Yahweh deal kindly with you, as you have dealt with the dead, and with me.

name: Ruth 1:9
text: Yahweh grant you that you may find rest, each of you in the house of her husband." Then she kissed them, and they lifted up their voice, and wept.

name: Ruth 1:10
text: They said to her, "No, but we will return with you to your people."

name: Ruth 1:11
text: Naomi said, "Go back, my daughters. Why do you want to go with me? Do I still have sons in my womb, that they may be your husbands?

name: Ruth 1:12
text: Go back, my daughters, go your way; for I am too old to have a husband. If I should say, "I have hope," if I should even have a husband tonight, and should also bear sons;

name: Ruth 1:13
text: would you then wait until they were grown? Would you then refrain from having husbands? No, my daughters, for it grieves me much for your sakes, for the hand of Yahweh has gone out against me."

name: Ruth 1:14
text: They lifted up their voice, and wept again: and Orpah kissed her mother-in-law, but Ruth joined with her.

name: Ruth 1:15
text: She said, "Behold, your sister-in-law has gone back to her people, and to her god. Follow your sister-in-law."

name: Ruth 1:16
text: Ruth said, "Don"t entreat me to leave you, and to return from following after you, for where you go, I will go; and where you lodge, I will lodge; your people shall be my people, and your God my God;

name: Ruth 1:17
text: where you die, will I die, and there will I be buried. Yahweh do so to me, and more also, if anything but death part you and me."

name: Ruth 1:18
text: When she saw that she was steadfastly minded to go with her, she left off speaking to her.

name: Ruth 1:19
text: So they two went until they came to Bethlehem. It happened, when they had come to Bethlehem, that all the city was moved about them, and they asked, "Is this Naomi?"

name: Ruth 1:20
text: She said to them, "Don"t call me Naomi. Call me Mara; for the Almighty has dealt very bitterly with me.

name: Ruth 1:21
text: I went out full, and Yahweh has brought me home again empty; why do you call me Naomi, since Yahweh has testified against me, and the Almighty has afflicted me?"

name: Ruth 1:22
text: So Naomi returned, and Ruth the Moabitess, her daughter-in-law, with her, who returned out of the country of Moab: and they came to Bethlehem in the beginning of barley harvest.

name: Ruth 2:1
text: Naomi had a kinsman of her husband"s, a mighty man of wealth, of the family of Elimelech, and his name was Boaz.

name: Ruth 2:2
text: Ruth the Moabitess said to Naomi, "Let me now go to the field, and glean among the ears of grain after him in whose sight I shall find favor." She said to her, "Go, my daughter."

name: Ruth 2:3
text: She went, and came and gleaned in the field after the reapers: and she happened to come to the portion of the field belonging to Boaz, who was of the family of Elimelech.

name: Ruth 2:4
text: Behold, Boaz came from Bethlehem, and said to the reapers, "Yahweh be with you." They answered him, "Yahweh bless you."

name: Ruth 2:5
text: Then Boaz said to his servant who was set over the reapers, "Whose young lady is this?"

name: Ruth 2:6
text: The servant who was set over the reapers answered, "It is the Moabite lady who came back with Naomi out of the country of Moab.

name: Ruth 2:7
text: She said, "Please let me glean and gather after the reapers among the sheaves." So she came, and has continued even from the morning until now, except that she stayed a little in the house."

name: Ruth 2:8
text: Then Boaz said to Ruth, "Listen, my daughter. Don"t go to glean in another field, and don"t go from here, but stay here close to my maidens.

name: Ruth 2:9
text: Let your eyes be on the field that they reap, and go after them. Haven"t I commanded the young men not to touch you? When you are thirsty, go to the vessels, and drink from that which the young men have drawn."

name: Ruth 2:10
text: Then she fell on her face, and bowed herself to the ground, and said to him, "Why have I found favor in your sight, that you should take knowledge of me, since I am a foreigner?"

name: Ruth 2:11
text: Boaz answered her, "It has fully been shown me, all that you have done to your mother-in-law since the death of your husband; and how you have left your father and your mother, and the land of your birth, and have come to a people that you didn"t know before.

name: Ruth 2:12
text: May Yahweh repay your work, and a full reward be given you from Yahweh, the God of Israel, under whose wings you have come to take refuge."

name: Ruth 2:13
text: Then she said, "Let me find favor in your sight, my lord, because you have comforted me, and because you have spoken kindly to your handmaid, though I am not as one of your handmaidens."

name: Ruth 2:14
text: At meal time Boaz said to her, "Come here, and eat of the bread, and dip your morsel in the vinegar." She sat beside the reapers, and they reached her parched grain, and she ate, and was satisfied, and left some of it.

name: Ruth 2:15
text: When she had risen up to glean, Boaz commanded his young men, saying, "Let her glean even among the sheaves, and don"t reproach her.

name: Ruth 2:16
text: Also pull out some for her from the bundles, and leave it, and let her glean, and don"t rebuke her."

name: Ruth 2:17
text: So she gleaned in the field until evening; and she beat out that which she had gleaned, and it was about an ephah of barley.

name: Ruth 2:18
text: She took it up, and went into the city; and her mother-in-law saw what she had gleaned: and she brought out and gave to her that which she had left after she was sufficed.

name: Ruth 2:19
text: Her mother-in-law said to her, "Where have you gleaned today? Where have you worked? Blessed be he who noticed you." She showed her mother-in-law with whom she had worked, and said, "The man"s name with whom I worked today is Boaz."

name: Ruth 2:20
text: Naomi said to her daughter-in-law, "Blessed be he of Yahweh, who has not left off his kindness to the living and to the dead." Naomi said to her, "The man is a close relative to us, one of our near kinsmen."

name: Ruth 2:21
text: Ruth the Moabitess said, "Yes, he said to me, "You shall stay close to my young men, until they have ended all my harvest.""

name: Ruth 2:22
text: Naomi said to Ruth her daughter-in-law, "It is good, my daughter, that you go out with his maidens, and that they not meet you in any other field."

name: Ruth 2:23
text: So she stayed close to the maidens of Boaz, to glean to the end of barley harvest and of wheat harvest; and she lived with her mother-in-law.

name: Ruth 3:1
text: Naomi her mother-in-law said to her, "My daughter, shall I not seek rest for you, that it may be well with you?

name: Ruth 3:2
text: Now isn"t Boaz our kinsman, with whose maidens you were? Behold, he winnows barley tonight in the threshing floor.

name: Ruth 3:3
text: Therefore wash yourself, anoint yourself, get dressed, and go down to the threshing floor, but don"t make yourself known to the man until he has finished eating and drinking.

name: Ruth 3:4
text: It shall be, when he lies down, that you shall mark the place where he shall lie, and you shall go in, and uncover his feet, and lay down; then he will tell you what you shall do."

name: Ruth 3:5
text: She said to her, "All that you say I will do."

name: Ruth 3:6
text: She went down to the threshing floor, and did according to all that her mother-in-law told her.

name: Ruth 3:7
text: When Boaz had eaten and drunk, and his heart was merry, he went to lie down at the end of the heap of grain. She came softly, uncovered his feet, and laid her down.

name: Ruth 3:8
text: It happened at midnight, that the man was startled and turned himself; and behold, a woman lay at his feet.

name: Ruth 3:9
text: He said, "Who are you?" She answered, "I am Ruth your handmaid. Therefore spread your skirt over your handmaid; for you are a near kinsman."

name: Ruth 3:10
text: He said, "Blessed are you by Yahweh, my daughter. You have shown more kindness in the latter end than at the beginning, inasmuch as you didn"t follow young men, whether poor or rich.

name: Ruth 3:11
text: Now, my daughter, don"t be afraid; I will do to you all that you say; for all the city of my people does know that you are a worthy woman.

name: Ruth 3:12
text: Now it is true that I am a near kinsman; however there is a kinsman nearer than I.

name: Ruth 3:13
text: Stay this night, and it shall be in the morning, that if he will perform for you the part of a kinsman, well; let him do the kinsman"s part. But if he will not do the part of a kinsman for you, then will I do the part of a kinsman for you, as Yahweh lives. Lie down until the morning."

name: Ruth 3:14
text: She lay at his feet until the morning. She rose up before one could discern another. For he said, "Let it not be known that the woman came to the threshing floor."

name: Ruth 3:15
text: He said, "Bring the mantle that is on you, and hold it." She held it; and he measured six measures of barley, and laid it on her; and he went into the city.

name: Ruth 3:16
text: When she came to her mother-in-law, she said, "How did it go, my daughter?" She told her all that the man had done to her.

name: Ruth 3:17
text: She said, "He gave me these six measures of barley; for he said, "Don"t go empty to your mother-in-law.""

name: Ruth 3:18
text: Then she said, "Sit still, my daughter, until you know how the matter will fall; for the man will not rest, until he has finished the thing this day."

name: Ruth 4:1
text: Now Boaz went up to the gate, and sat down there. Behold, the near kinsman of whom Boaz spoke came by; to whom he said, "Come over here, friend, and sit down!" He turned aside, and sat down.

name: Ruth 4:2
text: He took ten men of the elders of the city, and said, "Sit down here." They sat down.

name: Ruth 4:3
text: He said to the near kinsman, "Naomi, who has come back out of the country of Moab, is selling the parcel of land, which was our brother Elimelech"s.

name: Ruth 4:4
text: I thought to disclose it to you, saying, "Buy it before those who sit here, and before the elders of my people." If you will redeem it, redeem it; but if you will not redeem it, then tell me, that I may know. For there is no one to redeem it besides you; and I am after you." He said, "I will redeem it."

name: Ruth 4:5
text: Then Boaz said, "On the day you buy the field from the hand of Naomi, you must buy it also from Ruth the Moabitess, the wife of the dead, to raise up the name of the dead on his inheritance."

name: Ruth 4:6
text: The near kinsman said, "I can"t redeem it for myself, lest I mar my own inheritance. Take my right of redemption for yourself; for I can"t redeem it."

name: Ruth 4:7
text: Now this was the custom in former time in Israel concerning redeeming and concerning exchanging, to confirm all things: a man took off his shoe, and gave it to his neighbor; and this was the way of attestation in Israel.

name: Ruth 4:8
text: So the near kinsman said to Boaz, "Buy it for yourself." He took off his shoe.

name: Ruth 4:9
text: Boaz said to the elders, and to all the people, "You are witnesses this day, that I have bought all that was Elimelech"s, and all that was Chilion"s and Mahlon"s, from the hand of Naomi.

name: Ruth 4:10
text: Moreover Ruth the Moabitess, the wife of Mahlon, I have purchased to be my wife, to raise up the name of the dead on his inheritance, that the name of the dead not be cut off from among his brothers, and from the gate of his place. You are witnesses this day."

name: Ruth 4:11
text: All the people who were in the gate, and the elders, said, "We are witnesses. May Yahweh make the woman who has come into your house like Rachel and like Leah, which two built the house of Israel; and treat you worthily in Ephrathah, and be famous in Bethlehem.

name: Ruth 4:12
text: Let your house be like the house of Perez, whom Tamar bore to Judah, of the seed which Yahweh shall give you of this young woman."

name: Ruth 4:13
text: So Boaz took Ruth, and she became his wife; and he went in to her, and Yahweh gave her conception, and she bore a son.

name: Ruth 4:14
text: The women said to Naomi, "Blessed be Yahweh, who has not left you this day without a near kinsman; and let his name be famous in Israel.

name: Ruth 4:15
text: He shall be to you a restorer of life, and sustain you in your old age, for your daughter-in-law, who loves you, who is better to you than seven sons, has borne him."

name: Ruth 4:16
text: Naomi took the child, and laid it in her bosom, and became nurse to it.

name: Ruth 4:17
text: The women, her neighbors, gave him a name, saying, "There is a son born to Naomi;" and they named him Obed. He is the father of Jesse, the father of David.

name: Ruth 4:18
text: Now this is the history of the generations of Perez: Perez became the father of Hezron,

name: Ruth 4:19
text: and Hezron became the father of Ram, and Ram became the father of Amminadab,

name: Ruth 4:20
text: and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, and Nahshon became the father of Salmon,

name: Ruth 4:21
text: and Salmon became the father of Boaz, and Boaz became the father of Obed,

name: Ruth 4:22
text: and Obed became the father of Jesse, and Jesse became the father of David.

name: 1 Samuel 1:1
text: Now there was a certain man of Ramathaim Zophim, of the hill country of Ephraim, and his name was Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephraimite:

name: 1 Samuel 1:2
text: and he had two wives; the name of the one was Hannah, and the name of other Peninnah: and Peninnah had children, but Hannah had no children.

name: 1 Samuel 1:3
text: This man went up out of his city from year to year to worship and to sacrifice to Yahweh of Armies in Shiloh. The two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, priests to Yahweh, were there.

name: 1 Samuel 1:4
text: When the day came that Elkanah sacrificed, he gave to Peninnah his wife, and to all her sons and her daughters, portions:

name: 1 Samuel 1:5
text: but to Hannah he gave a double portion; for he loved Hannah, but Yahweh had shut up her womb.

name: 1 Samuel 1:6
text: Her rival provoked her severely, to make her fret, because Yahweh had shut up her womb.

name: 1 Samuel 1:7
text: As he did so year by year, when she went up to the house of Yahweh, so she provoked her; therefore she wept, and didn"t eat.

name: 1 Samuel 1:8
text: Elkanah her husband said to her, "Hannah, why do you weep? Why don"t you eat? Why is your heart grieved? Am I not better to you than ten sons?"

name: 1 Samuel 1:9
text: So Hannah rose up after they had eaten in Shiloh, and after they had drunk. Now Eli the priest was sitting on his seat by the doorpost of the temple of Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 1:10
text: She was in bitterness of soul, and prayed to Yahweh, and wept bitterly.

name: 1 Samuel 1:11
text: She vowed a vow, and said, "Yahweh of Armies, if you will indeed look on the affliction of your handmaid, and remember me, and not forget your handmaid, but will give to your handmaid a boy, then I will give him to Yahweh all the days of his life, and no razor shall come on his head."

name: 1 Samuel 1:12
text: It happened, as she continued praying before Yahweh, that Eli saw her mouth.

name: 1 Samuel 1:13
text: Now Hannah spoke in her heart. Only her lips moved, but her voice was not heard. Therefore Eli thought she had been drunken.

name: 1 Samuel 1:14
text: Eli said to her, "How long will you be drunken? Put away your wine from you."

name: 1 Samuel 1:15
text: Hannah answered, "No, my lord, I am a woman of a sorrowful spirit. I have drunk neither wine nor strong drink, but I poured out my soul before Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 1:16
text: Don"t count your handmaid for a wicked woman; for I have been speaking out of the abundance of my complaint and my provocation."

name: 1 Samuel 1:17
text: Then Eli answered, "Go in peace; and may the God of Israel grant your petition that you have asked of him."

name: 1 Samuel 1:18
text: She said, "Let your handmaid find favor in your sight." So the woman went her way, and ate; and her facial expression wasn"t sad any more.

name: 1 Samuel 1:19
text: They rose up in the morning early, and worshiped before Yahweh, and returned, and came to their house to Ramah: and Elkanah knew Hannah his wife; and Yahweh remembered her.

name: 1 Samuel 1:20
text: It happened, when the time had come, that Hannah conceived, and bore a son; and she named him Samuel, saying, "Because I have asked him of Yahweh."

name: 1 Samuel 1:21
text: The man Elkanah, and all his house, went up to offer to Yahweh the yearly sacrifice, and his vow.

name: 1 Samuel 1:22
text: But Hannah didn"t go up; for she said to her husband, "Not until the child is weaned; then I will bring him, that he may appear before Yahweh, and stay there forever."

name: 1 Samuel 1:23
text: Elkanah her husband said to her, "Do what seems good to you. Wait until you have weaned him; only may Yahweh establish his word." So the woman waited and nursed her son, until she weaned him.

name: 1 Samuel 1:24
text: When she had weaned him, she took him up with her, with three bulls, and one ephah of meal, and a bottle of wine, and brought him to Yahweh"s house in Shiloh. The child was young.

name: 1 Samuel 1:25
text: They killed the bull, and brought the child to Eli.

name: 1 Samuel 1:26
text: She said, "Oh, my lord, as your soul lives, my lord, I am the woman who stood by you here, praying to Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 1:27
text: For this child I prayed; and Yahweh has given me my petition which I asked of him.

name: 1 Samuel 1:28
text: Therefore also I have granted him to Yahweh. As long as he lives he is granted to Yahweh." He worshiped Yahweh there.

name: 1 Samuel 2:1
text: Hannah prayed, and said: "My heart exults in Yahweh! My horn is exalted in Yahweh. My mouth is enlarged over my enemies, because I rejoice in your salvation.

name: 1 Samuel 2:2
text: There is no one as holy as Yahweh, For there is no one besides you, nor is there any rock like our God.

name: 1 Samuel 2:3
text: "Talk no more so exceeding proudly. Don"t let arrogance come out of your mouth, For Yahweh is a God of knowledge. By him actions are weighed.

name: 1 Samuel 2:4
text: "The bows of the mighty men are broken. Those who stumbled are armed with strength.

name: 1 Samuel 2:5
text: Those who were full have hired themselves out for bread. Those who were hungry are satisfied. Yes, the barren has borne seven. She who has many children languishes.

name: 1 Samuel 2:6
text: "Yahweh kills, and makes alive. He brings down to Sheol, and brings up.

name: 1 Samuel 2:7
text: Yahweh makes poor, and makes rich. He brings low, he also lifts up.

name: 1 Samuel 2:8
text: He raises up the poor out of the dust. He lifts up the needy from the dunghill, To make them sit with princes, and inherit the throne of glory. For the pillars of the earth are Yahweh"s. He has set the world on them.

name: 1 Samuel 2:9
text: He will keep the feet of his holy ones, but the wicked shall be put to silence in darkness; for no man shall prevail by strength.

name: 1 Samuel 2:10
text: Those who strive with Yahweh shall be broken to pieces. He will thunder against them in the sky. "Yahweh will judge the ends of the earth. He will give strength to his king, and exalt the horn of his anointed."

name: 1 Samuel 2:11
text: Elkanah went to Ramah to his house. The child served Yahweh before Eli the priest.

name: 1 Samuel 2:12
text: Now the sons of Eli were base men; they didn"t know Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 2:13
text: The custom of the priests with the people was that when any man offered sacrifice, the priest"s servant came, while the flesh was boiling, with a fork of three teeth in his hand;

name: 1 Samuel 2:14
text: and he struck it into the pan, or kettle, or caldron, or pot; all that the fork brought up the priest took therewith. So they did in Shiloh to all the Israelites who came there.

name: 1 Samuel 2:15
text: Yes, before they burnt the fat, the priest"s servant came, and said to the man who sacrificed, "Give meat to roast for the priest; for he will not accept boiled meat from you, but raw."

name: 1 Samuel 2:16
text: If the man said to him, "Let the fat be burned first, and then take as much as your soul desires;" then he would say, "No, but you shall give it to me now; and if not, I will take it by force."

name: 1 Samuel 2:17
text: The sin of the young men was very great before Yahweh; for the men despised the offering of Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 2:18
text: But Samuel ministered before Yahweh, being a child, clothed with a linen ephod.

name: 1 Samuel 2:19
text: Moreover his mother made him a little robe, and brought it to him from year to year, when she came up with her husband to offer the yearly sacrifice.

name: 1 Samuel 2:20
text: Eli blessed Elkanah and his wife, and said, "Yahweh give you seed of this woman for the petition which was asked of Yahweh." They went to their own home.

name: 1 Samuel 2:21
text: Yahweh visited Hannah, and she conceived, and bore three sons and two daughters. The child Samuel grew before Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 2:22
text: Now Eli was very old; and he heard all that his sons did to all Israel, and how that they lay with the women who served at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

name: 1 Samuel 2:23
text: He said to them, "Why do you do such things? for I hear of your evil dealings from all this people.

name: 1 Samuel 2:24
text: No, my sons; for it is no good report that I hear: you make Yahweh"s people disobey.

name: 1 Samuel 2:25
text: If one man sin against another, God shall judge him; but if a man sin against Yahweh, who shall entreat for him?" Notwithstanding, they didn"t listen to the voice of their father, because Yahweh intended to kill them.

name: 1 Samuel 2:26
text: The child Samuel grew on, and increased in favor both with Yahweh, and also with men.

name: 1 Samuel 2:27
text: A man of God came to Eli, and said to him, "Thus says Yahweh, "Did I reveal myself to the house of your father, when they were in Egypt in bondage to Pharaoh"s house?

name: 1 Samuel 2:28
text: Did I choose him out of all the tribes of Israel to be my priest, to go up to my altar, to burn incense, to wear an ephod before me? Did I give to the house of your father all the offerings of the children of Israel made by fire?

name: 1 Samuel 2:29
text: Why do you kick at my sacrifice and at my offering, which I have commanded in my habitation, and honor your sons above me, to make yourselves fat with the best of all the offerings of Israel my people?"

name: 1 Samuel 2:30
text: "Therefore Yahweh, the God of Israel, says, "I said indeed that your house, and the house of your father, should walk before me forever." But now Yahweh says, "Be it far from me; for those who honor me I will honor, and those who despise me shall be lightly esteemed.

name: 1 Samuel 2:31
text: Behold, the days come, that I will cut off your arm, and the arm of your father"s house, that there shall not be an old man in your house.

name: 1 Samuel 2:32
text: You shall see the affliction of my habitation, in all the wealth which I shall give Israel; and there shall not be an old man in your house forever.

name: 1 Samuel 2:33
text: The man of yours, whom I shall not cut off from my altar, shall consume your eyes, and grieve your heart; and all the increase of your house shall die in the flower of their age.

name: 1 Samuel 2:34
text: ""This shall be the sign to you, that shall come on your two sons, on Hophni and Phinehas: in one day they shall both die.

name: 1 Samuel 2:35
text: I will raise me up a faithful priest, that shall do according to that which is in my heart and in my mind. I will build him a sure house; and he shall walk before my anointed forever.

name: 1 Samuel 2:36
text: It shall happen, that everyone who is left in your house shall come and bow down to him for a piece of silver and a loaf of bread, and shall say, "Please put me into one of the priests" offices, that I may eat a morsel of bread."""

name: 1 Samuel 3:1
text: The child Samuel ministered to Yahweh before Eli. The word of Yahweh was precious in those days; there was no frequent vision.

name: 1 Samuel 3:2
text: It happened at that time, when Eli was laid down in his place (now his eyes had begun to grow dim, so that he could not see),

name: 1 Samuel 3:3
text: and the lamp of God hadn"t yet gone out, and Samuel had laid down in the temple of Yahweh, where the ark of God was;

name: 1 Samuel 3:4
text: that Yahweh called Samuel; and he said, "Here I am."

name: 1 Samuel 3:5
text: He ran to Eli, and said, "Here I am; for you called me." He said, "I didn"t call; lie down again." He went and lay down.

name: 1 Samuel 3:6
text: Yahweh called yet again, "Samuel!" Samuel arose and went to Eli, and said, "Here I am; for you called me." He answered, "I didn"t call, my son; lie down again."

name: 1 Samuel 3:7
text: Now Samuel didn"t yet know Yahweh, neither was the word of Yahweh yet revealed to him.

name: 1 Samuel 3:8
text: Yahweh called Samuel again the third time. He arose and went to Eli, and said, "Here I am; for you called me." Eli perceived that Yahweh had called the child.

name: 1 Samuel 3:9
text: Therefore Eli said to Samuel, "Go, lie down: and it shall be, if he calls you, that you shall say, "Speak, Yahweh; for your servant hears."" So Samuel went and lay down in his place.

name: 1 Samuel 3:10
text: Yahweh came, and stood, and called as at other times, "Samuel! Samuel!" Then Samuel said, "Speak; for your servant hears."

name: 1 Samuel 3:11
text: Yahweh said to Samuel, "Behold, I will do a thing in Israel, at which both the ears of everyone who hears it shall tingle.

name: 1 Samuel 3:12
text: In that day I will perform against Eli all that I have spoken concerning his house, from the beginning even to the end.

name: 1 Samuel 3:13
text: For I have told him that I will judge his house forever, for the iniquity which he knew, because his sons brought a curse on themselves, and he didn"t restrain them.

name: 1 Samuel 3:14
text: Therefore I have sworn to the house of Eli, that the iniquity of Eli"s house shall not be removed with sacrifice nor offering forever."

name: 1 Samuel 3:15
text: Samuel lay until the morning, and opened the doors of the house of Yahweh. Samuel feared to show Eli the vision.

name: 1 Samuel 3:16
text: Then Eli called Samuel, and said, "Samuel, my son!" He said, "Here I am."

name: 1 Samuel 3:17
text: He said, "What is the thing that he has spoken to you? Please don"t hide it from me. God do so to you, and more also, if you hide anything from me of all the things that he spoke to you."

name: 1 Samuel 3:18
text: Samuel told him every bit, and hid nothing from him. He said, "It is Yahweh. Let him do what seems good to him."

name: 1 Samuel 3:19
text: Samuel grew, and Yahweh was with him, and let none of his words fall to the ground.

name: 1 Samuel 3:20
text: All Israel from Dan even to Beersheba knew that Samuel was established to be a prophet of Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 3:21
text: Yahweh appeared again in Shiloh; for Yahweh revealed himself to Samuel in Shiloh by the word of Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 4:1
text: The word of Samuel came to all Israel. Now Israel went out against the Philistines to battle, and encamped beside Ebenezer: and the Philistines encamped in Aphek.

name: 1 Samuel 4:2
text: The Philistines put themselves in array against Israel: and when they joined battle, Israel was struck before the Philistines; and they killed of the army in the field about four thousand men.

name: 1 Samuel 4:3
text: When the people had come into the camp, the elders of Israel said, "Why has Yahweh struck us today before the Philistines? Let us get the ark of the covenant of Yahweh out of Shiloh to us, that it may come among us, and save us out of the hand of our enemies."

name: 1 Samuel 4:4
text: So the people sent to Shiloh; and they brought from there the ark of the covenant of Yahweh of Armies, who sits above the cherubim: and the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, were there with the ark of the covenant of God.

name: 1 Samuel 4:5
text: When the ark of the covenant of Yahweh came into the camp, all Israel shouted with a great shout, so that the earth rang again.

name: 1 Samuel 4:6
text: When the Philistines heard the noise of the shout, they said, "What does the noise of this great shout in the camp of the Hebrews mean?" They understood that the ark of Yahweh had come into the camp.

name: 1 Samuel 4:7
text: The Philistines were afraid, for they said, "God has come into the camp." They said, "Woe to us! For there has not been such a thing before.

name: 1 Samuel 4:8
text: Woe to us! Who shall deliver us out of the hand of these mighty gods? These are the gods that struck the Egyptians with all kinds of plagues in the wilderness.

name: 1 Samuel 4:9
text: Be strong, and behave like men, O you Philistines, that you not be servants to the Hebrews, as they have been to you. Strengthen yourselves like men, and fight!"

name: 1 Samuel 4:10
text: The Philistines fought, and Israel was struck, and they fled every man to his tent: and there was a very great slaughter; for there fell of Israel thirty thousand footmen.

name: 1 Samuel 4:11
text: The ark of God was taken; and the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, were slain.

name: 1 Samuel 4:12
text: There ran a man of Benjamin out of the army, and came to Shiloh the same day, with his clothes torn, and with earth on his head.

name: 1 Samuel 4:13
text: When he came, behold, Eli was sitting on his seat by the road watching; for his heart trembled for the ark of God. When the man came into the city, and told it, all the city cried out.

name: 1 Samuel 4:14
text: When Eli heard the noise of the crying, he said, "What does the noise of this tumult mean?" The man hurried, and came and told Eli.

name: 1 Samuel 4:15
text: Now Eli was ninety-eight years old; and his eyes were set, so that he could not see.

name: 1 Samuel 4:16
text: The man said to Eli, "I am he who came out of the army, and I fled today out of the army." He said, "How did the matter go, my son?"

name: 1 Samuel 4:17
text: He who brought the news answered, "Israel has fled before the Philistines, and there has been also a great slaughter among the people. Your two sons also, Hophni and Phinehas, are dead, and the ark of God has been captured."

name: 1 Samuel 4:18
text: It happened, when he made mention of the ark of God, that Eli fell from off his seat backward by the side of the gate; and his neck broke, and he died; for he was an old man, and heavy. He had judged Israel forty years.

name: 1 Samuel 4:19
text: His daughter-in-law, Phinehas" wife, was with child, near to be delivered. When she heard the news that the ark of God was taken, and that her father-in-law and her husband were dead, she bowed herself and gave birth; for her pains came on her.

name: 1 Samuel 4:20
text: About the time of her death the women who stood by her said to her, "Don"t be afraid; for you have given birth to a son." But she didn"t answer, neither did she regard it.

name: 1 Samuel 4:21
text: She named the child Ichabod, saying, "The glory has departed from Israel;" because the ark of God was taken, and because of her father-in-law and her husband.

name: 1 Samuel 4:22
text: She said, "The glory has departed from Israel; for the ark of God is taken."

name: 1 Samuel 5:1
text: Now the Philistines had taken the ark of God, and they brought it from Ebenezer to Ashdod.

name: 1 Samuel 5:2
text: The Philistines took the ark of God, and brought it into the house of Dagon, and set it by Dagon.

name: 1 Samuel 5:3
text: When they of Ashdod arose early on the next day, behold, Dagon was fallen on his face to the ground before the ark of Yahweh. They took Dagon, and set him in his place again.

name: 1 Samuel 5:4
text: When they arose early on the next day morning, behold, Dagon was fallen on his face to the ground before the ark of Yahweh; and the head of Dagon and both the palms of his hands were cut off on the threshold. Only Dagon"s torso was intact.

name: 1 Samuel 5:5
text: Therefore neither the priests of Dagon, nor any who come into Dagon"s house, tread on the threshold of Dagon in Ashdod, to this day.

name: 1 Samuel 5:6
text: But the hand of Yahweh was heavy on them of Ashdod, and he destroyed them, and struck them with tumors, even Ashdod and its borders.

name: 1 Samuel 5:7
text: When the men of Ashdod saw that it was so, they said, "The ark of the God of Israel shall not stay with us; for his hand is severe on us, and on Dagon our god."

name: 1 Samuel 5:8
text: They sent therefore and gathered all the lords of the Philistines to them, and said, "What shall we do with the ark of the God of Israel?" They answered, "Let the ark of the God of Israel be carried over to Gath." They carried the ark of the God of Israel there.

name: 1 Samuel 5:9
text: It was so, that after they had carried it about, the hand of Yahweh was against the city with a very great confusion: and he struck the men of the city, both small and great; and tumors broke out on them.

name: 1 Samuel 5:10
text: So they sent the ark of God to Ekron. It happened, as the ark of God came to Ekron, that the Ekronites cried out, saying, "They have brought about the ark of the God of Israel to us, to kill us and our people."

name: 1 Samuel 5:11
text: They sent therefore and gathered together all the lords of the Philistines, and they said, "Send away the ark of the God of Israel, and let it go again to its own place, that it not kill us and our people." For there was a deadly confusion throughout all the city; the hand of God was very heavy there.

name: 1 Samuel 5:12
text: The men who didn"t die were struck with the tumors; and the cry of the city went up to heaven.

name: 1 Samuel 6:1
text: The ark of Yahweh was in the country of the Philistines seven months.

name: 1 Samuel 6:2
text: The Philistines called for the priests and the diviners, saying, "What shall we do with the ark of Yahweh? Show us with which we shall send it to its place."

name: 1 Samuel 6:3
text: They said, "If you send away the ark of the God of Israel, don"t send it empty; but by all means return him a trespass offering: then you shall be healed, and it shall be known to you why his hand is not removed from you."

name: 1 Samuel 6:4
text: Then they said, "What shall be the trespass offering which we shall return to him?" They said, "Five golden tumors, and five golden mice, for the number of the lords of the Philistines; for one plague was on you all, and on your lords.

name: 1 Samuel 6:5
text: Therefore you shall make images of your tumors, and images of your mice that mar the land; and you shall give glory to the God of Israel: perhaps he will lighten his hand from off you, and from off your gods, and from off your land.

name: 1 Samuel 6:6
text: Why then do you harden your hearts, as the Egyptians and Pharaoh hardened their hearts? When he had worked wonderfully among them, didn"t they let the people go, and they departed?

name: 1 Samuel 6:7
text: "Now therefore take and prepare yourselves a new cart, and two milk cows, on which there has come no yoke; and tie the cows to the cart, and bring their calves home from them;

name: 1 Samuel 6:8
text: and take the ark of Yahweh, and lay it on the cart; and put the jewels of gold, which you return him for a trespass offering, in a coffer by its side; and send it away, that it may go.

name: 1 Samuel 6:9
text: Behold; if it goes up by the way of its own border to Beth Shemesh, then he has done us this great evil: but if not, then we shall know that it is not his hand that struck us; it was a chance that happened to us."

name: 1 Samuel 6:10
text: The men did so, and took two milk cows, and tied them to the cart, and shut up their calves at home;

name: 1 Samuel 6:11
text: and they put the ark of Yahweh on the cart, and the coffer with the mice of gold and the images of their tumors.

name: 1 Samuel 6:12
text: The cows took the straight way by the way to Beth Shemesh; they went along the highway, lowing as they went, and didn"t turn aside to the right hand or to the left; and the lords of the Philistines went after them to the border of Beth Shemesh.

name: 1 Samuel 6:13
text: They of Beth Shemesh were reaping their wheat harvest in the valley; and they lifted up their eyes, and saw the ark, and rejoiced to see it.

name: 1 Samuel 6:14
text: The cart came into the field of Joshua of Beth Shemesh, and stood there, where there was a great stone: and they split the wood of the cart, and offered up the cows for a burnt offering to Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 6:15
text: The Levites took down the ark of Yahweh, and the coffer that was with it, in which the jewels of gold were, and put them on the great stone: and the men of Beth Shemesh offered burnt offerings and sacrificed sacrifices the same day to Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 6:16
text: When the five lords of the Philistines had seen it, they returned to Ekron the same day.

name: 1 Samuel 6:17
text: These are the golden tumors which the Philistines returned for a trespass offering to Yahweh: for Ashdod one, for Gaza one, for Ashkelon one, for Gath one, for Ekron one;

name: 1 Samuel 6:18
text: and the golden mice, according to the number of all the cities of the Philistines belonging to the five lords, both of fortified cities and of country villages, even to the great stone, whereon they set down the ark of Yahweh. That stone remains to this day in the field of Joshua of Beth Shemesh.

name: 1 Samuel 6:19
text: He struck of the men of Beth Shemesh, because they had looked into the ark of Yahweh, he struck of the people fifty thousand seventy men; and the people mourned, because Yahweh had struck the people with a great slaughter.

name: 1 Samuel 6:20
text: The men of Beth Shemesh said, "Who is able to stand before Yahweh, this holy God? To whom shall he go up from us?"

name: 1 Samuel 6:21
text: They sent messengers to the inhabitants of Kiriath Jearim, saying, "The Philistines have brought back the ark of Yahweh; come down, and bring it up to yourselves."

name: 1 Samuel 7:1
text: The men of Kiriath Jearim came, and fetched up the ark of Yahweh, and brought it into the house of Abinadab in the hill, and sanctified Eleazar his son to keep the ark of Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 7:2
text: It happened, from the day that the ark stayed in Kiriath Jearim, that the time was long; for it was twenty years: and all the house of Israel lamented after Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 7:3
text: Samuel spoke to all the house of Israel, saying, "If you do return to Yahweh with all your heart, then put away the foreign gods and the Ashtaroth from among you, and direct your hearts to Yahweh, and serve him only; and he will deliver you out of the hand of the Philistines."

name: 1 Samuel 7:4
text: Then the children of Israel removed the Baals and the Ashtaroth, and served Yahweh only.

name: 1 Samuel 7:5
text: Samuel said, "Gather all Israel to Mizpah, and I will pray for you to Yahweh."

name: 1 Samuel 7:6
text: They gathered together to Mizpah, and drew water, and poured it out before Yahweh, and fasted on that day, and said there, "We have sinned against Yahweh." Samuel judged the children of Israel in Mizpah.

name: 1 Samuel 7:7
text: When the Philistines heard that the children of Israel were gathered together at Mizpah, the lords of the Philistines went up against Israel. When the children of Israel heard it, they were afraid of the Philistines.

name: 1 Samuel 7:8
text: The children of Israel said to Samuel, "Don"t cease to cry to Yahweh our God for us, that he will save us out of the hand of the Philistines."

name: 1 Samuel 7:9
text: Samuel took a suckling lamb, and offered it for a whole burnt offering to Yahweh: and Samuel cried to Yahweh for Israel; and Yahweh answered him.

name: 1 Samuel 7:10
text: As Samuel was offering up the burnt offering, the Philistines drew near to battle against Israel; but Yahweh thundered with a great thunder on that day on the Philistines, and confused them; and they were struck down before Israel.

name: 1 Samuel 7:11
text: The men of Israel went out of Mizpah, and pursued the Philistines, and struck them, until they came under Beth Kar.

name: 1 Samuel 7:12
text: Then Samuel took a stone, and set it between Mizpah and Shen, and called its name Ebenezer, saying, "Yahweh helped us until now."

name: 1 Samuel 7:13
text: So the Philistines were subdued, and they came no more within the border of Israel. The hand of Yahweh was against the Philistines all the days of Samuel.

name: 1 Samuel 7:14
text: The cities which the Philistines had taken from Israel were restored to Israel, from Ekron even to Gath; and Israel recovered its border out of the hand of the Philistines. There was peace between Israel and the Amorites.

name: 1 Samuel 7:15
text: Samuel judged Israel all the days of his life.

name: 1 Samuel 7:16
text: He went from year to year in circuit to Bethel and Gilgal, and Mizpah; and he judged Israel in all those places.

name: 1 Samuel 7:17
text: His return was to Ramah, for there was his house; and there he judged Israel: and he built there an altar to Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 8:1
text: It happened, when Samuel was old, that he made his sons judges over Israel.

name: 1 Samuel 8:2
text: Now the name of his firstborn was Joel; and the name of his second, Abijah: they were judges in Beersheba.

name: 1 Samuel 8:3
text: His sons didn"t walk in his ways, but turned aside after lucre, and took bribes, and perverted justice.

name: 1 Samuel 8:4
text: Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together, and came to Samuel to Ramah;

name: 1 Samuel 8:5
text: and they said to him, "Behold, you are old, and your sons don"t walk in your ways: now make us a king to judge us like all the nations."

name: 1 Samuel 8:6
text: But the thing displeased Samuel, when they said, "Give us a king to judge us." Samuel prayed to Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 8:7
text: Yahweh said to Samuel, "Listen to the voice of the people in all that they tell you; for they have not rejected you, but they have rejected me, that I should not be king over them.

name: 1 Samuel 8:8
text: According to all the works which they have done since the day that I brought them up out of Egypt even to this day, in that they have forsaken me, and served other gods, so do they also to you.

name: 1 Samuel 8:9
text: Now therefore listen to their voice: however you shall protest solemnly to them, and shall show them the way of the king who shall reign over them."

name: 1 Samuel 8:10
text: Samuel told all the words of Yahweh to the people who asked of him a king.

name: 1 Samuel 8:11
text: He said, "This will be the way of the king who shall reign over you: he will take your sons, and appoint them to him, for his chariots, and to be his horsemen; and they shall run before his chariots;

name: 1 Samuel 8:12
text: and he will appoint them to him for captains of thousands, and captains of fifties; and he will assign some to plow his ground, and to reap his harvest, and to make his instruments of war, and the instruments of his chariots.

name: 1 Samuel 8:13
text: He will take your daughters to be perfumers, and to be cooks, and to be bakers.

name: 1 Samuel 8:14
text: He will take your fields, and your vineyards, and your olive groves, even their best, and give them to his servants.

name: 1 Samuel 8:15
text: He will take the tenth of your seed, and of your vineyards, and give to his officers, and to his servants.

name: 1 Samuel 8:16
text: He will take your male servants, and your female servants, and your best young men, and your donkeys, and put them to his work.

name: 1 Samuel 8:17
text: He will take the tenth of your flocks: and you shall be his servants.

name: 1 Samuel 8:18
text: You shall cry out in that day because of your king whom you shall have chosen you; and Yahweh will not answer you in that day."

name: 1 Samuel 8:19
text: But the people refused to listen to the voice of Samuel; and they said, "No; but we will have a king over us,

name: 1 Samuel 8:20
text: that we also may be like all the nations, and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles."

name: 1 Samuel 8:21
text: Samuel heard all the words of the people, and he rehearsed them in the ears of Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 8:22
text: Yahweh said to Samuel, "Listen to their voice, and make them a king." Samuel said to the men of Israel, "Every man go to his city."

name: 1 Samuel 9:1
text: Now there was a man of Benjamin, whose name was Kish, the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Becorath, the son of Aphiah, the son of a Benjamite, a mighty man of valor.

name: 1 Samuel 9:2
text: He had a son, whose name was Saul, an impressive young man; and there was not among the children of Israel a better person than he. From his shoulders and upward he was higher than any of the people.

name: 1 Samuel 9:3
text: The donkeys of Kish, Saul"s father, were lost. Kish said to Saul his son, "Take now one of the servants with you, and arise, go seek the donkeys."

name: 1 Samuel 9:4
text: He passed through the hill country of Ephraim, and passed through the land of Shalishah, but they didn"t find them: then they passed through the land of Shaalim, and there they weren"t there: and he passed through the land of the Benjamites, but they didn"t find them.

name: 1 Samuel 9:5
text: When they had come to the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant who was with him, "Come, and let us return, lest my father stop caring about the donkeys, and be anxious for us."

name: 1 Samuel 9:6
text: He said to him, "See now, there is in this city a man of God, and he is a man who is held in honor. All that he says comes surely to pass. Now let us go there. Perhaps he can tell us concerning our journey whereon we go."

name: 1 Samuel 9:7
text: Then Saul said to his servant, "But, behold, if we go, what shall we bring the man? For the bread is spent in our vessels, and there is not a present to bring to the man of God. What do we have?"

name: 1 Samuel 9:8
text: The servant answered Saul again, and said, "Behold, I have in my hand the fourth part of a shekel of silver. I will give that to the man of God, to tell us our way."

name: 1 Samuel 9:9
text: (In earlier times in Israel, when a man went to inquire of God, thus he said, "Come, and let us go to the seer;" for he who is now called a prophet was before called a Seer.)

name: 1 Samuel 9:10
text: Then Saul said to his servant, "Well said. Come, let us go." So they went to the city where the man of God was.

name: 1 Samuel 9:11
text: As they went up the ascent to the city, they found young maidens going out to draw water, and said to them, "Is the seer here?"

name: 1 Samuel 9:12
text: They answered them, and said, "He is. Behold, he is before you. Hurry now, for he has come today into the city; for the people have a sacrifice today in the high place.

name: 1 Samuel 9:13
text: As soon as you have come into the city, you shall immediately find him, before he goes up to the high place to eat; for the people will not eat until he come, because he blesses the sacrifice. Afterwards those who are invited eat. Now therefore go up; for at this time you shall find him."

name: 1 Samuel 9:14
text: They went up to the city. As they came within the city, behold, Samuel came out toward them, to go up to the high place.

name: 1 Samuel 9:15
text: Now Yahweh had revealed to Samuel a day before Saul came, saying,

name: 1 Samuel 9:16
text: "Tomorrow about this time I will send you a man out of the land of Benjamin, and you shall anoint him to be prince over my people Israel; and he shall save my people out of the hand of the Philistines: for I have looked on my people, because their cry has come to me."

name: 1 Samuel 9:17
text: When Samuel saw Saul, Yahweh said to him, "Behold, the man of whom I spoke to you! this same shall have authority over my people."

name: 1 Samuel 9:18
text: Then Saul drew near to Samuel in the gate, and said, "Please tell me where the seer"s house is."

name: 1 Samuel 9:19
text: Samuel answered Saul, and said, "I am the seer. Go up before me to the high place, for you shall eat with me today. In the morning I will let you go, and will tell you all that is in your heart.

name: 1 Samuel 9:20
text: As for your donkeys who were lost three days ago, don"t set your mind on them; for they are found. For whom is all that is desirable in Israel? Is it not for you, and for all your father"s house?"

name: 1 Samuel 9:21
text: Saul answered, "Am I not a Benjamite, of the smallest of the tribes of Israel? And my family the least of all the families of the tribe of Benjamin? Why then do you speak to me like this?"

name: 1 Samuel 9:22
text: Samuel took Saul and his servant, and brought them into the guest room, and made them sit in the best place among those who were invited, who were about thirty persons.

name: 1 Samuel 9:23
text: Samuel said to the cook, "Bring the portion which I gave you, of which I said to you, "Set it aside.""

name: 1 Samuel 9:24
text: The cook took up the thigh, and that which was on it, and set it before Saul. Samuel said, "Behold, that which has been reserved! Set it before yourself and eat; because for the appointed time has it been kept for you, for I said, "I have invited the people."" So Saul ate with Samuel that day.

name: 1 Samuel 9:25
text: When they had come down from the high place into the city, he talked with Saul on the housetop.

name: 1 Samuel 9:26
text: They arose early: and it happened about the spring of the day, that Samuel called to Saul on the housetop, saying, "Get up, that I may send you away." Saul arose, and they went out both of them, he and Samuel, abroad.

name: 1 Samuel 9:27
text: As they were going down at the end of the city, Samuel said to Saul, "Tell the servant pass on before us" (and he passed on), "but stand still first, that I may cause you to hear the word of God."

name: 1 Samuel 10:1
text: Then Samuel took the vial of oil, and poured it on his head, and kissed him, and said, "Isn"t it that Yahweh has anointed you to be prince over his inheritance?

name: 1 Samuel 10:2
text: When you have departed from me today, then you shall find two men by Rachel"s tomb, in the border of Benjamin at Zelzah; and they will tell you, "The donkeys which you went to seek have been found; and behold, your father has stopped caring about the donkeys, and is anxious for you, saying, "What shall I do for my son?""

name: 1 Samuel 10:3
text: "Then you shall go on forward from there, and you shall come to the oak of Tabor; and three men shall meet you there going up to God to Bethel, one carrying three young goats, and another carrying three loaves of bread, and another carrying a bottle of wine:

name: 1 Samuel 10:4
text: and they will greet you, and give you two loaves of bread, which you shall receive of their hand.

name: 1 Samuel 10:5
text: "After that you shall come to the hill of God, where is the garrison of the Philistines: and it shall happen, when you have come there to the city, that you shall meet a band of prophets coming down from the high place with a psaltery, and a tambourine, and a pipe, and a harp, before them; and they will be prophesying:

name: 1 Samuel 10:6
text: and the Spirit of Yahweh will come mightily on you, and you shall prophesy with them, and shall be turned into another man.

name: 1 Samuel 10:7
text: Let it be, when these signs have come to you, that you do as occasion shall serve you; for God is with you.

name: 1 Samuel 10:8
text: "You shall go down before me to Gilgal; and behold, I will come down to you, to offer burnt offerings, and to sacrifice sacrifices of peace offerings: you shall wait seven days, until I come to you, and show you what you shall do."

name: 1 Samuel 10:9
text: It was so, that when he had turned his back to go from Samuel, God gave him another heart: and all those signs happened that day.

name: 1 Samuel 10:10
text: When they came there to the hill, behold, a band of prophets met him; and the Spirit of God came mightily on him, and he prophesied among them.

name: 1 Samuel 10:11
text: It happened, when all who knew him before saw that, behold, he prophesied with the prophets, then the people said one to another, "What is this that has come to the son of Kish? Is Saul also among the prophets?"

name: 1 Samuel 10:12
text: One of the same place answered, "Who is their father?" Therefore it became a proverb, "Is Saul also among the prophets?"

name: 1 Samuel 10:13
text: When he had made an end of prophesying, he came to the high place.

name: 1 Samuel 10:14
text: Saul"s uncle said to him and to his servant, "Where did you go?" He said, "To seek the donkeys. When we saw that they were not found, we came to Samuel."

name: 1 Samuel 10:15
text: Saul"s uncle said, "Please tell me what Samuel said to you."

name: 1 Samuel 10:16
text: Saul said to his uncle, "He told us plainly that the donkeys were found." But concerning the matter of the kingdom, of which Samuel spoke, he didn"t tell him.

name: 1 Samuel 10:17
text: Samuel called the people together to Yahweh to Mizpah;

name: 1 Samuel 10:18
text: and he said to the children of Israel, "Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, "I brought up Israel out of Egypt, and I delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all the kingdoms that oppressed you:"

name: 1 Samuel 10:19
text: but you have this day rejected your God, who himself saves you out of all your calamities and your distresses; and you have said to him, "No! Set a king over us." Now therefore present yourselves before Yahweh by your tribes, and by your thousands."

name: 1 Samuel 10:20
text: So Samuel brought all the tribes of Israel near, and the tribe of Benjamin was taken.

name: 1 Samuel 10:21
text: He brought the tribe of Benjamin near by their families; and the family of the Matrites was taken; and Saul the son of Kish was taken: but when they sought him, he could not be found.

name: 1 Samuel 10:22
text: Therefore they asked of Yahweh further, "Is there yet a man to come here?" Yahweh answered, "Behold, he has hidden himself among the baggage."

name: 1 Samuel 10:23
text: They ran and fetched him there; and when he stood among the people, he was higher than any of the people from his shoulders and upward.

name: 1 Samuel 10:24
text: Samuel said to all the people, "You see him whom Yahweh has chosen, that there is none like him among all the people?" All the people shouted, and said, "Let the king live!"

name: 1 Samuel 10:25
text: Then Samuel told the people the regulations of the kingdom, and wrote it in a book, and laid it up before Yahweh. Samuel sent all the people away, every man to his house.

name: 1 Samuel 10:26
text: Saul also went to his house to Gibeah; and there went with him the army, whose hearts God had touched.

name: 1 Samuel 10:27
text: But certain worthless fellows said, "How shall this man save us?" They despised him, and brought him no present. But he held his peace.

name: 1 Samuel 11:1
text: Then Nahash the Ammonite came up, and encamped against Jabesh Gilead: and all the men of Jabesh said to Nahash, "Make a covenant with us, and we will serve you."

name: 1 Samuel 11:2
text: Nahash the Ammonite said to them, "On this condition I will make it with you, that all your right eyes be put out; and I will lay it for a reproach on all Israel."

name: 1 Samuel 11:3
text: The elders of Jabesh said to him, "Give us seven day, that we may send messengers to all the borders of Israel; and then, if there is no one to save us, we will come out to you."

name: 1 Samuel 11:4
