text: Then the messengers came to Gibeah of Saul, and spoke these words in the ears of the people: and all the people lifted up their voice, and wept.

name: 1 Samuel 11:5
text: Behold, Saul came following the oxen out of the field; and Saul said, "What ails the people that they weep?" They told him the words of the men of Jabesh.

name: 1 Samuel 11:6
text: The Spirit of God came mightily on Saul when he heard those words, and his anger was kindled greatly.

name: 1 Samuel 11:7
text: He took a yoke of oxen, and cut them in pieces, and sent them throughout all the borders of Israel by the hand of messengers, saying, "Whoever doesn"t come forth after Saul and after Samuel, so shall it be done to his oxen." The dread of Yahweh fell on the people, and they came out as one man.

name: 1 Samuel 11:8
text: He numbered them in Bezek; and the children of Israel were three hundred thousand, and the men of Judah thirty thousand.

name: 1 Samuel 11:9
text: They said to the messengers who came, "Thus you shall tell the men of Jabesh Gilead, "Tomorrow, by the time the sun is hot, you shall have deliverance."" The messengers came and told the men of Jabesh; and they were glad.

name: 1 Samuel 11:10
text: Therefore the men of Jabesh said, "Tomorrow we will come out to you, and you shall do with us all that seems good to you."

name: 1 Samuel 11:11
text: It was so on the next day, that Saul put the people in three companies; and they came into the midst of the camp in the morning watch, and struck the Ammonites until the heat of the day: and it happened, that those who remained were scattered, so that no two of them were left together.

name: 1 Samuel 11:12
text: The people said to Samuel, "Who is he who said, "Shall Saul reign over us?" Bring those men, that we may put them to death!"

name: 1 Samuel 11:13
text: Saul said, "There shall not a man be put to death this day; for today Yahweh has worked deliverance in Israel."

name: 1 Samuel 11:14
text: Then Samuel said to the people, "Come, and let us go to Gilgal, and renew the kingdom there."

name: 1 Samuel 11:15
text: All the people went to Gilgal; and there they made Saul king before Yahweh in Gilgal; and there they offered sacrifices of peace offerings before Yahweh; and there Saul and all the men of Israel rejoiced greatly.

name: 1 Samuel 12:1
text: Samuel said to all Israel, "Behold, I have listened to your voice in all that you said to me, and have made a king over you.

name: 1 Samuel 12:2
text: Now, behold, the king walks before you; and I am old and gray-headed; and behold, my sons are with you: and I have walked before you from my youth to this day.

name: 1 Samuel 12:3
text: Here I am. Witness against me before Yahweh, and before his anointed. Whose ox have I taken? Whose donkey have I taken? Whom have I defrauded? Whom have I oppressed? Of whose hand have I taken a ransom to blind my eyes therewith? I will restore it to you."

name: 1 Samuel 12:4
text: They said, "You have not defrauded us, nor oppressed us, neither have you taken anything of any man"s hand."

name: 1 Samuel 12:5
text: He said to them, "Yahweh is witness against you, and his anointed is witness this day, that you have not found anything in my hand." They said, "He is witness."

name: 1 Samuel 12:6
text: Samuel said to the people, "It is Yahweh who appointed Moses and Aaron, and that brought your fathers up out of the land of Egypt.

name: 1 Samuel 12:7
text: Now therefore stand still, that I may plead with you before Yahweh concerning all the righteous acts of Yahweh, which he did to you and to your fathers.

name: 1 Samuel 12:8
text: "When Jacob had come into Egypt, and your fathers cried to Yahweh, then Yahweh sent Moses and Aaron, who brought your fathers out of Egypt, and made them to dwell in this place.

name: 1 Samuel 12:9
text: "But they forgot Yahweh their God; and he sold them into the hand of Sisera, captain of the army of Hazor, and into the hand of the Philistines, and into the hand of the king of Moab; and they fought against them.

name: 1 Samuel 12:10
text: They cried to Yahweh, and said, "We have sinned, because we have forsaken Yahweh, and have served the Baals and the Ashtaroth: but now deliver us out of the hand of our enemies, and we will serve you."

name: 1 Samuel 12:11
text: Yahweh sent Jerubbaal, and Bedan, and Jephthah, and Samuel, and delivered you out of the hand of your enemies on every side; and you lived in safety.

name: 1 Samuel 12:12
text: "When you saw that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon came against you, you said to me, "No, but a king shall reign over us;" when Yahweh your God was your king.

name: 1 Samuel 12:13
text: Now therefore see the king whom you have chosen, and whom you have asked for: and behold, Yahweh has set a king over you.

name: 1 Samuel 12:14
text: If you will fear Yahweh, and serve him, and listen to his voice, and not rebel against the commandment of Yahweh, then both you and also the king who reigns over you are followers of Yahweh your God.

name: 1 Samuel 12:15
text: But if you will not listen to the voice of Yahweh, but rebel against the commandment of Yahweh, then will the hand of Yahweh be against you, as it was against your fathers.

name: 1 Samuel 12:16
text: "Now therefore stand still and see this great thing, which Yahweh will do before your eyes.

name: 1 Samuel 12:17
text: Isn"t it wheat harvest today? I will call to Yahweh, that he may send thunder and rain; and you shall know and see that your wickedness is great, which you have done in the sight of Yahweh, in asking for a king."

name: 1 Samuel 12:18
text: So Samuel called to Yahweh; and Yahweh sent thunder and rain that day: and all the people greatly feared Yahweh and Samuel.

name: 1 Samuel 12:19
text: All the people said to Samuel, "Pray for your servants to Yahweh your God, that we not die; for we have added to all our sins this evil, to ask us a king."

name: 1 Samuel 12:20
text: Samuel said to the people, "Don"t be afraid. You have indeed done all this evil; yet don"t turn aside from following Yahweh, but serve Yahweh with all your heart.

name: 1 Samuel 12:21
text: Don"t turn aside to go after vain things which can"t profit nor deliver, for they are vain.

name: 1 Samuel 12:22
text: For Yahweh will not forsake his people for his great name"s sake, because it has pleased Yahweh to make you a people to himself.

name: 1 Samuel 12:23
text: Moreover as for me, far be it from me that I should sin against Yahweh in ceasing to pray for you: but I will instruct you in the good and the right way.

name: 1 Samuel 12:24
text: Only fear Yahweh, and serve him in truth with all your heart; for consider how great things he has done for you.

name: 1 Samuel 12:25
text: But if you shall still do wickedly, you shall be consumed, both you and your king."

name: 1 Samuel 13:1
text: Saul reigned a year; and when he had reigned two years over Israel,

name: 1 Samuel 13:2
text: Saul chose for himself three thousand men of Israel, of which two thousand were with Saul in Michmash and in the Mount of Bethel, and one thousand were with Jonathan in Gibeah of Benjamin: and the rest of the people he sent every man to his tent.

name: 1 Samuel 13:3
text: Jonathan struck the garrison of the Philistines that was in Geba: and the Philistines heard of it. Saul blew the trumpet throughout all the land, saying, "Let the Hebrews hear!"

name: 1 Samuel 13:4
text: All Israel heard that Saul had struck the garrison of the Philistines, and also that Israel was had in abomination with the Philistines. The people were gathered together after Saul to Gilgal.

name: 1 Samuel 13:5
text: The Philistines assembled themselves together to fight with Israel, thirty thousand chariots, and six thousand horsemen, and people as the sand which is on the seashore in multitude: and they came up, and encamped in Michmash, eastward of Beth Aven.

name: 1 Samuel 13:6
text: When the men of Israel saw that they were in a strait (for the people were distressed), then the people hid themselves in caves, and in thickets, and in rocks, and in coverts, and in pits.

name: 1 Samuel 13:7
text: Now some of the Hebrews had gone over the Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead; but as for Saul, he was yet in Gilgal, and all the people followed him trembling.

name: 1 Samuel 13:8
text: He stayed seven days, according to the time set by Samuel: but Samuel didn"t come to Gilgal; and the people were scattered from him.

name: 1 Samuel 13:9
text: Saul said, "Bring here the burnt offering to me, and the peace offerings." He offered the burnt offering.

name: 1 Samuel 13:10
text: It came to pass that as soon as he had made an end of offering the burnt offering, behold, Samuel came; and Saul went out to meet him, that he might greet him.

name: 1 Samuel 13:11
text: Samuel said, "What have you done?" Saul said, "Because I saw that the people were scattered from me, and that you didn"t come within the days appointed, and that the Philistines assembled themselves together at Michmash;

name: 1 Samuel 13:12
text: therefore I said, "Now the Philistines will come down on me to Gilgal, and I haven"t entreated the favor of Yahweh." I forced myself therefore, and offered the burnt offering."

name: 1 Samuel 13:13
text: Samuel said to Saul, "You have done foolishly. You have not kept the commandment of Yahweh your God, which he commanded you; for now Yahweh would have established your kingdom on Israel forever.

name: 1 Samuel 13:14
text: But now your kingdom shall not continue. Yahweh has sought for himself a man after his own heart, and Yahweh has appointed him to be prince over his people, because you have not kept that which Yahweh commanded you."

name: 1 Samuel 13:15
text: Samuel arose, and went from Gilgal to Gibeah of Benjamin. Saul numbered the people who were present with him, about six hundred men.

name: 1 Samuel 13:16
text: Saul, and Jonathan his son, and the people who were present with them, stayed in Geba of Benjamin: but the Philistines encamped in Michmash.

name: 1 Samuel 13:17
text: The spoilers came out of the camp of the Philistines in three companies: one company turned to the way that leads to Ophrah, to the land of Shual;

name: 1 Samuel 13:18
text: and another company turned the way to Beth Horon; and another company turned the way of the border that looks down on the valley of Zeboim toward the wilderness.

name: 1 Samuel 13:19
text: Now there was no smith found throughout all the land of Israel; for the Philistines said, "Lest the Hebrews make them swords or spears;"

name: 1 Samuel 13:20
text: but all the Israelites went down to the Philistines, to sharpen every man his plowshare, mattock, axe, and sickle;

name: 1 Samuel 13:21
text: yet they had a file for the mattocks, and for the plowshares, and for the forks, and for the axes, and to set the goads.

name: 1 Samuel 13:22
text: So it came to pass in the day of battle, that there was neither sword nor spear found in the hand of any of the people who were with Saul and Jonathan: but with Saul and with Jonathan his son was there found.

name: 1 Samuel 13:23
text: The garrison of the Philistines went out to the pass of Michmash.

name: 1 Samuel 14:1
text: Now it fell on a day, that Jonathan the son of Saul said to the young man who bore his armor, "Come, and let us go over to the Philistines" garrison, that is on the other side." But he didn"t tell his father.

name: 1 Samuel 14:2
text: Saul stayed in the uttermost part of Gibeah under the pomegranate tree which is in Migron: and the people who were with him were about six hundred men;

name: 1 Samuel 14:3
text: and Ahijah, the son of Ahitub, Ichabod"s brother, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eli, the priest of Yahweh in Shiloh, wearing an ephod. The people didn"t know that Jonathan was gone.

name: 1 Samuel 14:4
text: Between the passes, by which Jonathan sought to go over to the Philistines" garrison, there was a rocky crag on the one side, and a rocky crag on the other side: and the name of the one was Bozez, and the name of the other Seneh.

name: 1 Samuel 14:5
text: The one crag rose up on the north in front of Michmash, and the other on the south in front of Geba.

name: 1 Samuel 14:6
text: Jonathan said to the young man who bore his armor, "Come, and let us go over to the garrison of these uncircumcised. It may be that Yahweh will work for us; for there is no restraint on Yahweh to save by many or by few."

name: 1 Samuel 14:7
text: His armor bearer said to him, "Do all that is in your heart. Turn and, behold, I am with you according to your heart."

name: 1 Samuel 14:8
text: Then Jonathan said, "Behold, we will pass over to the men, and we will reveal ourselves to them.

name: 1 Samuel 14:9
text: If they say thus to us, "Wait until we come to you!" then we will stand still in our place, and will not go up to them.

name: 1 Samuel 14:10
text: But if they say this, "Come up to us!" then we will go up; for Yahweh has delivered them into our hand. This shall be the sign to us."

name: 1 Samuel 14:11
text: Both of them revealed themselves to the garrison of the Philistines: and the Philistines said, "Behold, the Hebrews are coming out of the holes where they had hidden themselves!"

name: 1 Samuel 14:12
text: The men of the garrison answered Jonathan and his armor bearer, and said, "Come up to us, and we will show you something!" Jonathan said to his armor bearer, "Come up after me; for Yahweh has delivered them into the hand of Israel."

name: 1 Samuel 14:13
text: Jonathan climbed up on his hands and on his feet, and his armor bearer after him: and they fell before Jonathan; and his armor bearer killed them after him.

name: 1 Samuel 14:14
text: That first slaughter, which Jonathan and his armor bearer made, was about twenty men, within as it were half a furrow"s length in an acre of land.

name: 1 Samuel 14:15
text: There was a trembling in the camp, in the field, and among all the people; the garrison, and the spoilers, they also trembled; and the earth quaked: so there was an exceeding great trembling.

name: 1 Samuel 14:16
text: The watchmen of Saul in Gibeah of Benjamin looked; and behold, the multitude melted away, and scattered.

name: 1 Samuel 14:17
text: Then Saul said to the people who were with him, "Count now, and see who is missing from us." When they had counted, behold, Jonathan and his armor bearer were not there.

name: 1 Samuel 14:18
text: Saul said to Ahijah, "Bring the ark of God here." For the ark of God was with the children of Israel at that time.

name: 1 Samuel 14:19
text: It happened, while Saul talked to the priest, that the tumult that was in the camp of the Philistines went on and increased: and Saul said to the priest, "Withdraw your hand!"

name: 1 Samuel 14:20
text: Saul and all the people who were with him were gathered together, and came to the battle: and behold, every man"s sword was against his fellow: a very great confusion.

name: 1 Samuel 14:21
text: Now the Hebrews who were with the Philistines as before, and who went up with them into the camp, from all around, even they also turned to be with the Israelites who were with Saul and Jonathan.

name: 1 Samuel 14:22
text: Likewise all the men of Israel who had hidden themselves in the hill country of Ephraim, when they heard that the Philistines fled, even they also followed hard after them in the battle.

name: 1 Samuel 14:23
text: So Yahweh saved Israel that day: and the battle passed over by Beth Aven.

name: 1 Samuel 14:24
text: The men of Israel were distressed that day; for Saul had adjured the people, saying, "Cursed is the man who eats any food until it is evening, and I am avenged of my enemies." So none of the people tasted food.

name: 1 Samuel 14:25
text: All the people came into the forest; and there was honey on the ground.

name: 1 Samuel 14:26
text: When the people had come to the forest, behold, the honey dropped: but no man put his hand to his mouth; for the people feared the oath.

name: 1 Samuel 14:27
text: But Jonathan didn"t hear when his father commanded the people with the oath: therefore he put forth the end of the rod who was in his hand, and dipped it in the honeycomb, and put his hand to his mouth; and his eyes were enlightened.

name: 1 Samuel 14:28
text: Then one of the people answered, and said, "Your father directly commanded the people with an oath, saying, "Cursed is the man who eats food this day."" The people were faint.

name: 1 Samuel 14:29
text: Then Jonathan said, "My father has troubled the land. Please look how my eyes have been enlightened, because I tasted a little of this honey.

name: 1 Samuel 14:30
text: How much more, if perhaps the people had eaten freely today of the spoil of their enemies which they found? For now has there been no great slaughter among the Philistines."

name: 1 Samuel 14:31
text: They struck of the Philistines that day from Michmash to Aijalon. The people were very faint;

name: 1 Samuel 14:32
text: and the people flew on the spoil, and took sheep, and cattle, and calves, and killed them on the ground; and the people ate them with the blood.

name: 1 Samuel 14:33
text: Then they told Saul, saying, "Behold, the people are sinning against Yahweh, in that they eat meat with the blood." He said, "You have dealt treacherously. Roll a large stone to me this day!"

name: 1 Samuel 14:34
text: Saul said, "Disperse yourselves among the people, and tell them, "Bring me here every man his ox, and every man his sheep, and kill them here, and eat; and don"t sin against Yahweh in eating meat with the blood."" All the people brought every man his ox with him that night, and killed them there.

name: 1 Samuel 14:35
text: Saul built an altar to Yahweh. This was the first altar that he built to Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 14:36
text: Saul said, "Let us go down after the Philistines by night, and take spoil among them until the morning light, and let us not leave a man of them." They said, "Do whatever seems good to you." Then the priest said, "Let us draw near here to God."

name: 1 Samuel 14:37
text: Saul asked counsel of God, "Shall I go down after the Philistines? Will you deliver them into the hand of Israel?" But he didn"t answer him that day.

name: 1 Samuel 14:38
text: Saul said, "Draw near here, all you chiefs of the people; and know and see in which this sin has been this day.

name: 1 Samuel 14:39
text: For, as Yahweh lives, who saves Israel, though it is in Jonathan my son, he shall surely die." But there was not a man among all the people who answered him.

name: 1 Samuel 14:40
text: Then he said to all Israel, "You be on one side, and I and Jonathan my son will be on the other side." The people said to Saul, "Do what seems good to you."

name: 1 Samuel 14:41
text: Therefore Saul said to Yahweh, the God of Israel, "Show the right." Jonathan and Saul were chosen; but the people escaped.

name: 1 Samuel 14:42
text: Saul said, "Cast lots between me and Jonathan my son." Jonathan was selected.

name: 1 Samuel 14:43
text: Then Saul said to Jonathan, "Tell me what you have done!" Jonathan told him, and said, "I certainly did taste a little honey with the end of the rod that was in my hand; and behold, I must die."

name: 1 Samuel 14:44
text: Saul said, "God do so and more also; for you shall surely die, Jonathan."

name: 1 Samuel 14:45
text: The people said to Saul, "Shall Jonathan die, who has worked this great salvation in Israel? Far from it! As Yahweh lives, there shall not one hair of his head fall to the ground; for he has worked with God this day!" So the people rescued Jonathan, that he didn"t die.

name: 1 Samuel 14:46
text: Then Saul went up from following the Philistines; and the Philistines went to their own place.

name: 1 Samuel 14:47
text: Now when Saul had taken the kingdom over Israel, he fought against all his enemies on every side, against Moab, and against the children of Ammon, and against Edom, and against the kings of Zobah, and against the Philistines: and wherever he turned himself, he defeated them.

name: 1 Samuel 14:48
text: He did valiantly, and struck the Amalekites, and delivered Israel out of the hands of those who despoiled them.

name: 1 Samuel 14:49
text: Now the sons of Saul were Jonathan, and Ishvi, and Malchishua; and the names of his two daughters were these: the name of the firstborn Merab, and the name of the younger Michal:

name: 1 Samuel 14:50
text: and the name of Saul"s wife was Ahinoam the daughter of Ahimaaz. The name of the captain of his army was Abner the son of Ner, Saul"s uncle.

name: 1 Samuel 14:51
text: Kish was the father of Saul; and Ner the father of Abner was the son of Abiel.

name: 1 Samuel 14:52
text: There was severe war against the Philistines all the days of Saul: and when Saul saw any mighty man, or any valiant man, he took him to him.

name: 1 Samuel 15:1
text: Samuel said to Saul, "Yahweh sent me to anoint you to be king over his people, over Israel. Now therefore listen to the voice of the words of Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 15:2
text: Thus says Yahweh of Armies, "I have marked that which Amalek did to Israel, how he set himself against him in the way, when he came up out of Egypt.

name: 1 Samuel 15:3
text: Now go and strike Amalek, and utterly destroy all that they have, and don"t spare them; but kill both man and woman, infant and nursing baby, ox and sheep, camel and donkey.""

name: 1 Samuel 15:4
text: Saul summoned the people, and numbered them in Telaim, two hundred thousand footmen, and ten thousand men of Judah.

name: 1 Samuel 15:5
text: Saul came to the city of Amalek, and laid wait in the valley.

name: 1 Samuel 15:6
text: Saul said to the Kenites, "Go, depart, go down from among the Amalekites, lest I destroy you with them; for you showed kindness to all the children of Israel, when they came up out of Egypt." So the Kenites departed from among the Amalekites.

name: 1 Samuel 15:7
text: Saul struck the Amalekites, from Havilah as you go to Shur, that is before Egypt.

name: 1 Samuel 15:8
text: He took Agag the king of the Amalekites alive, and utterly destroyed all the people with the edge of the sword.

name: 1 Samuel 15:9
text: But Saul and the people spared Agag, and the best of the sheep, and of the cattle, and of the fatlings, and the lambs, and all that was good, and wouldn"t utterly destroy them: but everything that was vile and refuse, that they destroyed utterly.

name: 1 Samuel 15:10
text: Then the word of Yahweh came to Samuel, saying,

name: 1 Samuel 15:11
text: "It grieves me that I have set up Saul to be king; for he is turned back from following me, and has not performed my commandments." Samuel was angry; and he cried to Yahweh all night.

name: 1 Samuel 15:12
text: Samuel rose early to meet Saul in the morning; and it was told Samuel, saying, "Saul came to Carmel, and behold, he set up a monument for himself, and turned, and passed on, and went down to Gilgal."

name: 1 Samuel 15:13
text: Samuel came to Saul; and Saul said to him, "You are blessed by Yahweh! I have performed the commandment of Yahweh."

name: 1 Samuel 15:14
text: Samuel said, "Then what does this bleating of the sheep in my ears, and the lowing of the cattle which I hear mean?"

name: 1 Samuel 15:15
text: Saul said, "They have brought them from the Amalekites; for the people spared the best of the sheep and of the cattle, to sacrifice to Yahweh your God. We have utterly destroyed the rest."

name: 1 Samuel 15:16
text: Then Samuel said to Saul, "Stay, and I will tell you what Yahweh has said to me last night." He said to him, "Say on."

name: 1 Samuel 15:17
text: Samuel said, "Though you were little in your own sight, weren"t you made the head of the tribes of Israel? Yahweh anointed you king over Israel;

name: 1 Samuel 15:18
text: and Yahweh sent you on a journey, and said, "Go, and utterly destroy the sinners the Amalekites, and fight against them until they are consumed."

name: 1 Samuel 15:19
text: Why then didn"t you obey the voice of Yahweh, but took the spoils, and did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh?"

name: 1 Samuel 15:20
text: Saul said to Samuel, "But I have obeyed the voice of Yahweh, and have gone the way which Yahweh sent me, and have brought Agag the king of Amalek, and have utterly destroyed the Amalekites.

name: 1 Samuel 15:21
text: But the people took of the spoil, sheep and cattle, the chief of the devoted things, to sacrifice to Yahweh your God in Gilgal."

name: 1 Samuel 15:22
text: Samuel said, "Has Yahweh as great delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices, as in obeying the voice of Yahweh? Behold, to obey is better than sacrifice, and to listen than the fat of rams.

name: 1 Samuel 15:23
text: For rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft, and stubbornness is as idolatry and teraphim. Because you have rejected the word of Yahweh, he has also rejected you from being king."

name: 1 Samuel 15:24
text: Saul said to Samuel, "I have sinned; for I have transgressed the commandment of Yahweh, and your words, because I feared the people, and obeyed their voice.

name: 1 Samuel 15:25
text: Now therefore, please pardon my sin, and turn again with me, that I may worship Yahweh."

name: 1 Samuel 15:26
text: Samuel said to Saul, "I will not return with you; for you have rejected the word of Yahweh, and Yahweh has rejected you from being king over Israel."

name: 1 Samuel 15:27
text: As Samuel turned about to go away, Saul grabbed the skirt of his robe, and it tore.

name: 1 Samuel 15:28
text: Samuel said to him, "Yahweh has torn the kingdom of Israel from you this day, and has given it to a neighbor of yours who is better than you.

name: 1 Samuel 15:29
text: Also the Strength of Israel will not lie nor repent; for he is not a man, that he should repent."

name: 1 Samuel 15:30
text: Then he said, "I have sinned: yet please honor me now before the elders of my people, and before Israel, and come back with me, that I may worship Yahweh your God."

name: 1 Samuel 15:31
text: So Samuel went back with Saul; and Saul worshiped Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 15:32
text: Then Samuel said, "Bring here to me Agag the king of the Amalekites!" Agag came to him cheerfully. Agag said, "Surely the bitterness of death is past."

name: 1 Samuel 15:33
text: Samuel said, "As your sword has made women childless, so your mother will be childless among women!" Samuel cut Agag in pieces before Yahweh in Gilgal.

name: 1 Samuel 15:34
text: Then Samuel went to Ramah; and Saul went up to his house to Gibeah of Saul.

name: 1 Samuel 15:35
text: Samuel came no more to see Saul until the day of his death; for Samuel mourned for Saul: and Yahweh grieved that he had made Saul king over Israel.

name: 1 Samuel 16:1
text: Yahweh said to Samuel, "How long will you mourn for Saul, since I have rejected him from being king over Israel? Fill your horn with oil, and go. I will send you to Jesse the Bethlehemite; for I have provided a king for myself among his sons."

name: 1 Samuel 16:2
text: Samuel said, "How can I go? If Saul hears it, he will kill me." Yahweh said, "Take a heifer with you, and say, I have come to sacrifice to Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 16:3
text: Call Jesse to the sacrifice, and I will show you what you shall do. You shall anoint to me him whom I name to you."

name: 1 Samuel 16:4
text: Samuel did that which Yahweh spoke, and came to Bethlehem. The elders of the city came to meet him trembling, and said, "Do you come peaceably?"

name: 1 Samuel 16:5
text: He said, "Peaceably; I have come to sacrifice to Yahweh. Sanctify yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice." He sanctified Jesse and his sons, and called them to the sacrifice.

name: 1 Samuel 16:6
text: It happened, when they had come, that he looked at Eliab, and said, "Surely Yahweh"s anointed is before him."

name: 1 Samuel 16:7
text: But Yahweh said to Samuel, "Don"t look on his face, or on the height of his stature; because I have rejected him: for I see not as man sees; for man looks at the outward appearance, but Yahweh looks at the heart."

name: 1 Samuel 16:8
text: Then Jesse called Abinadab, and made him pass before Samuel. He said, "Neither has Yahweh chosen this one."

name: 1 Samuel 16:9
text: Then Jesse made Shammah to pass by. He said, "Neither has Yahweh chosen this one."

name: 1 Samuel 16:10
text: Jesse made seven of his sons to pass before Samuel. Samuel said to Jesse, "Yahweh has not chosen these."

name: 1 Samuel 16:11
text: Samuel said to Jesse, "Are all your children here?" He said, "There remains yet the youngest, and behold, he is keeping the sheep." Samuel said to Jesse, "Send and get him; for we will not sit down until he comes here."

name: 1 Samuel 16:12
text: He sent, and brought him in. Now he was ruddy, and withal of a beautiful face, and goodly to look on. Yahweh said, "Arise, anoint him; for this is he."

name: 1 Samuel 16:13
text: Then Samuel took the horn of oil, and anointed him in the midst of his brothers: and the Spirit of Yahweh came mightily on David from that day forward. So Samuel rose up, and went to Ramah.

name: 1 Samuel 16:14
text: Now the Spirit of Yahweh departed from Saul, and an evil spirit from Yahweh troubled him.

name: 1 Samuel 16:15
text: Saul"s servants said to him, "See now, an evil spirit from God troubles you.

name: 1 Samuel 16:16
text: Let our lord now command your servants who are before you, to seek out a man who is a skillful player on the harp. It shall happen, when the evil spirit from God is on you, that he shall play with his hand, and you shall be well."

name: 1 Samuel 16:17
text: Saul said to his servants, "Provide me now a man who can play well, and bring him to me."

name: 1 Samuel 16:18
text: Then one of the young men answered, and said, "Behold, I have seen a son of Jesse the Bethlehemite, who is skillful in playing, a mighty man of valor, a man of war, prudent in speech, and a comely person; and Yahweh is with him."

name: 1 Samuel 16:19
text: Therefore Saul sent messengers to Jesse, and said, "Send me David your son, who is with the sheep."

name: 1 Samuel 16:20
text: Jesse took a donkey loaded with bread, and a bottle of wine, and a young goat, and sent them by David his son to Saul.

name: 1 Samuel 16:21
text: David came to Saul, and stood before him. He loved him greatly; and he became his armor bearer.

name: 1 Samuel 16:22
text: Saul sent to Jesse, saying, "Please let David stand before me; for he has found favor in my sight."

name: 1 Samuel 16:23
text: It happened, when the spirit from God was on Saul, that David took the harp, and played with his hand: so Saul was refreshed, and was well, and the evil spirit departed from him.

name: 1 Samuel 17:1
text: Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle; and they were gathered together at Socoh, which belongs to Judah, and encamped between Socoh and Azekah, in Ephesdammim.

name: 1 Samuel 17:2
text: Saul and the men of Israel were gathered together, and encamped in the valley of Elah, and set the battle in array against the Philistines.

name: 1 Samuel 17:3
text: The Philistines stood on the mountain on the one side, and Israel stood on the mountain on the other side: and there was a valley between them.

name: 1 Samuel 17:4
text: There went out a champion out of the camp of the Philistines, named Goliath, of Gath, whose height was six cubits and a span.

name: 1 Samuel 17:5
text: He had a helmet of brass on his head, and he was clad with a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of brass.

name: 1 Samuel 17:6
text: He had brass shin armor on his legs, and a javelin of brass between his shoulders.

name: 1 Samuel 17:7
text: The staff of his spear was like a weaver"s beam; and his spear"s head weighed six hundred shekels of iron: and his shield bearer went before him.

name: 1 Samuel 17:8
text: He stood and cried to the armies of Israel, and said to them, "Why have you come out to set your battle in array? Am I not a Philistine, and you servants to Saul? Choose a man for yourselves, and let him come down to me.

name: 1 Samuel 17:9
text: If he be able to fight with me, and kill me, then will we be your servants; but if I prevail against him, and kill him, then you will be our servants, and serve us."

name: 1 Samuel 17:10
text: The Philistine said, "I defy the armies of Israel this day! Give me a man, that we may fight together!"

name: 1 Samuel 17:11
text: When Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine, they were dismayed, and greatly afraid.

name: 1 Samuel 17:12
text: Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Bethlehem Judah, whose name was Jesse; and he had eight sons: and the man was an old man in the days of Saul, stricken among men.

name: 1 Samuel 17:13
text: The three eldest sons of Jesse had gone after Saul to the battle: and the names of his three sons who went to the battle were Eliab the firstborn, and next to him Abinadab, and the third Shammah.

name: 1 Samuel 17:14
text: David was the youngest; and the three eldest followed Saul.

name: 1 Samuel 17:15
text: Now David went back and forth from Saul to feed his father"s sheep at Bethlehem.

name: 1 Samuel 17:16
text: The Philistine drew near morning and evening, and presented himself forty days.

name: 1 Samuel 17:17
text: Jesse said to David his son, "Now take for your brothers an ephah of this parched grain, and these ten loaves, and carry them quickly to the camp to your brothers;

name: 1 Samuel 17:18
text: and bring these ten cheeses to the captain of their thousand, and see how your brothers are doing, and bring back news."

name: 1 Samuel 17:19
text: Now Saul, and they, and all the men of Israel, were in the valley of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.

name: 1 Samuel 17:20
text: David rose up early in the morning, and left the sheep with a keeper, and took, and went, as Jesse had commanded him; and he came to the place of the wagons, as the army which was going forth to the fight shouted for the battle.

name: 1 Samuel 17:21
text: Israel and the Philistines put the battle in array, army against army.

name: 1 Samuel 17:22
text: David left his baggage in the hand of the keeper of the baggage, and ran to the army, and came and greeted his brothers.

name: 1 Samuel 17:23
text: As he talked with them, behold, there came up the champion, the Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, out of the ranks of the Philistines, and spoke according to the same words: and David heard them.

name: 1 Samuel 17:24
text: All the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from him, and were terrified.

name: 1 Samuel 17:25
text: The men of Israel said, "Have you seen this man who has come up? He has surely come up to defy Israel. It shall be, that the man who kills him, the king will enrich him with great riches, and will give him his daughter, and make his father"s house free in Israel."

name: 1 Samuel 17:26
text: David spoke to the men who stood by him, saying, "What shall be done to the man who kills this Philistine, and takes away the reproach from Israel? For who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should defy the armies of the living God?"

name: 1 Samuel 17:27
text: The people answered him in this way, saying, "So shall it be done to the man who kills him."

name: 1 Samuel 17:28
text: Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spoke to the men; and Eliab"s anger was kindled against David, and he said, "Why have you come down? With whom have you left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know your pride, and the naughtiness of your heart; for you have come down that you might see the battle."

name: 1 Samuel 17:29
text: David said, "What have I now done? Is there not a cause?"

name: 1 Samuel 17:30
text: He turned away from him toward another, and spoke like that again; and the people answered him again the same way.

name: 1 Samuel 17:31
text: When the words were heard which David spoke, they rehearsed them before Saul; and he sent for him.

name: 1 Samuel 17:32
text: David said to Saul, "Let no man"s heart fail because of him. Your servant will go and fight with this Philistine."

name: 1 Samuel 17:33
text: Saul said to David, "You are not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him; for you are but a youth, and he a man of war from his youth."

name: 1 Samuel 17:34
text: David said to Saul, "Your servant was keeping his father"s sheep; and when a lion or a bear came, and took a lamb out of the flock,

name: 1 Samuel 17:35
text: I went out after him, and struck him, and rescued it out of his mouth. When he arose against me, I caught him by his beard, and struck him, and killed him.

name: 1 Samuel 17:36
text: Your servant struck both the lion and the bear. This uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, since he has defied the armies of the living God."

name: 1 Samuel 17:37
text: David said, "Yahweh who delivered me out of the paw of the lion, and out of the paw of the bear, he will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine." Saul said to David, "Go; and Yahweh shall be with you."

name: 1 Samuel 17:38
text: Saul dressed David with his clothing. He put a helmet of brass on his head, and he clad him with a coat of mail.

name: 1 Samuel 17:39
text: David strapped his sword on his clothing, and he tried to move; for he had not tested it. David said to Saul, "I can"t go with these; for I have not tested them." David took them off.

name: 1 Samuel 17:40
text: He took his staff in his hand, and chose for himself five smooth stones out of the brook, and put them in the shepherd"s bag which he had, even in his wallet. His sling was in his hand; and he drew near to the Philistine.

name: 1 Samuel 17:41
text: The Philistine came on and drew near to David; and the man who bore the shield went before him.

name: 1 Samuel 17:42
text: When the Philistine looked about, and saw David, he disdained him; for he was but a youth, and ruddy, and withal of a fair face.

name: 1 Samuel 17:43
text: The Philistine said to David, "Am I a dog, that you come to me with sticks?" The Philistine cursed David by his gods.

name: 1 Samuel 17:44
text: The Philistine said to David, "Come to me, and I will give your flesh to the birds of the sky, and to the animals of the field."

name: 1 Samuel 17:45
text: Then David said to the Philistine, "You come to me with a sword, and with a spear, and with a javelin: but I come to you in the name of Yahweh of Armies, the God of the armies of Israel, whom you have defied.

name: 1 Samuel 17:46
text: Today, Yahweh will deliver you into my hand. I will strike you, and take your head from off you. I will give the dead bodies of the army of the Philistines this day to the birds of the sky, and to the wild animals of the earth; that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel,

name: 1 Samuel 17:47
text: and that all this assembly may know that Yahweh doesn"t save with sword and spear: for the battle is Yahweh"s, and he will give you into our hand."

name: 1 Samuel 17:48
text: It happened, when the Philistine arose, and came and drew near to meet David, that David hurried, and ran toward the army to meet the Philistine.

name: 1 Samuel 17:49
text: David put his hand in his bag, took a stone, and slung it, and struck the Philistine in his forehead; and the stone sank into his forehead, and he fell on his face to the earth.

name: 1 Samuel 17:50
text: So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and struck the Philistine, and killed him; but there was no sword in the hand of David.

name: 1 Samuel 17:51
text: Then David ran, and stood over the Philistine, and took his sword, and drew it out of its sheath, and killed him, and cut off his head therewith. When the Philistines saw that their champion was dead, they fled.

name: 1 Samuel 17:52
text: The men of Israel and of Judah arose, and shouted, and pursued the Philistines, until you come to Gai, and to the gates of Ekron. The wounded of the Philistines fell down by the way to Shaaraim, even to Gath, and to Ekron.

name: 1 Samuel 17:53
text: The children of Israel returned from chasing after the Philistines, and they plundered their camp.

name: 1 Samuel 17:54
text: David took the head of the Philistine, and brought it to Jerusalem; but he put his armor in his tent.

name: 1 Samuel 17:55
text: When Saul saw David go forth against the Philistine, he said to Abner, the captain of the army, "Abner, whose son is this youth?" Abner said, "As your soul lives, O king, I can"t tell."

name: 1 Samuel 17:56
text: The king said, "Inquire whose son the young man is!"

name: 1 Samuel 17:57
text: As David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, Abner took him, and brought him before Saul with the head of the Philistine in his hand.

name: 1 Samuel 17:58
text: Saul said to him, "Whose son are you, you young man?" David answered, "I am the son of your servant Jesse the Bethlehemite."

name: 1 Samuel 18:1
text: It happened, when he had made an end of speaking to Saul, that the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David, and Jonathan loved him as his own soul.

name: 1 Samuel 18:2
text: Saul took him that day, and would let him go no more home to his father"s house.

name: 1 Samuel 18:3
text: Then Jonathan and David made a covenant, because he loved him as his own soul.

name: 1 Samuel 18:4
text: Jonathan stripped himself of the robe that was on him, and gave it to David, and his clothing, even to his sword, and to his bow, and to his sash.

name: 1 Samuel 18:5
text: David went out wherever Saul sent him, and behaved himself wisely: and Saul set him over the men of war, and it was good in the sight of all the people, and also in the sight of Saul"s servants.

name: 1 Samuel 18:6
text: It happened as they came, when David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, that the women came out of all the cities of Israel, singing and dancing, to meet king Saul, with tambourines, with joy, and with instruments of music.

name: 1 Samuel 18:7
text: The women sang one to another as they played, and said, "Saul has slain his thousands, David his ten thousands."

name: 1 Samuel 18:8
text: Saul was very angry, and this saying displeased him; and he said, "They have ascribed to David ten thousands, and to me they have ascribed but thousands. What can he have more but the kingdom?"

name: 1 Samuel 18:9
text: Saul eyed David from that day and forward.

name: 1 Samuel 18:10
text: It happened on the next day, that an evil spirit from God came mightily on Saul, and he prophesied in the midst of the house. David played with his hand, as he did day by day. Saul had his spear in his hand;

name: 1 Samuel 18:11
text: and Saul threw the spear; for he said, "I will pin David even to the wall!" David escaped from his presence twice.

name: 1 Samuel 18:12
text: Saul was afraid of David, because Yahweh was with him, and was departed from Saul.

name: 1 Samuel 18:13
text: Therefore Saul removed him from him, and made him his captain over a thousand; and he went out and came in before the people.

name: 1 Samuel 18:14
text: David behaved himself wisely in all his ways; and Yahweh was with him.

name: 1 Samuel 18:15
text: When Saul saw that he behaved himself very wisely, he stood in awe of him.

name: 1 Samuel 18:16
text: But all Israel and Judah loved David; for he went out and came in before them.

name: 1 Samuel 18:17
text: Saul said to David, "Behold, my elder daughter Merab, I will give her to you as wife. Only be valiant for me, and fight Yahweh"s battles." For Saul said, "Don"t let my hand be on him, but let the hand of the Philistines be on him."

name: 1 Samuel 18:18
text: David said to Saul, "Who am I, and what is my life, or my father"s family in Israel, that I should be son-in-law to the king?"

name: 1 Samuel 18:19
text: But it happened at the time when Merab, Saul"s daughter, should have been given to David, that she was given to Adriel the Meholathite as wife.

name: 1 Samuel 18:20
text: Michal, Saul"s daughter, loved David; and they told Saul, and the thing pleased him.

name: 1 Samuel 18:21
text: Saul said, I will give her to him, that she may be a snare to him, and that the hand of the Philistines may be against him. Therefore Saul said to David, "You shall this day be my son-in-law a second time."

name: 1 Samuel 18:22
text: Saul commanded his servants, "Talk with David secretly, and say, "Behold, the king has delight in you, and all his servants love you: now therefore be the king"s son-in-law.""

name: 1 Samuel 18:23
text: Saul"s servants spoke those words in the ears of David. David said, "Does it seems to you a light thing to be the king"s son-in-law, since I am a poor man, and lightly esteemed?"

name: 1 Samuel 18:24
text: The servants of Saul told him, saying, "David spoke like this."

name: 1 Samuel 18:25
text: Saul said, "You shall tell David, "The king desires no dowry except one hundred foreskins of the Philistines, to be avenged of the king"s enemies."" Now Saul thought to make David fall by the hand of the Philistines.

name: 1 Samuel 18:26
text: When his servants told David these words, it pleased David well to be the king"s son-in-law. The days were not expired;

name: 1 Samuel 18:27
text: and David arose and went, he and his men, and killed of the Philistines two hundred men; and David brought their foreskins, and they gave them in full number to the king, that he might be the king"s son-in-law. Saul gave him Michal his daughter as wife.

name: 1 Samuel 18:28
text: Saul saw and knew that Yahweh was with David; and Michal, Saul"s daughter, loved him.

name: 1 Samuel 18:29
text: Saul was yet the more afraid of David; and Saul was David"s enemy continually.

name: 1 Samuel 18:30
text: Then the princes of the Philistines went forth: and it happened, as often as they went forth, that David behaved himself more wisely than all the servants of Saul; so that his name was highly esteemed.

name: 1 Samuel 19:1
text: Saul spoke to Jonathan his son, and to all his servants, that they should kill David. But Jonathan, Saul"s son, delighted much in David.

name: 1 Samuel 19:2
text: Jonathan told David, saying, "Saul my father seeks to kill you. Now therefore, please take care of yourself in the morning, and live in a secret place, and hide yourself.

name: 1 Samuel 19:3
text: I will go out and stand beside my father in the field where you are, and I will talk with my father about you; and if I see anything, I will tell you."

name: 1 Samuel 19:4
text: Jonathan spoke good of David to Saul his father, and said to him, "Don"t let the king sin against his servant, against David; because he has not sinned against you, and because his works have been very good toward you;

name: 1 Samuel 19:5
text: for he put his life in his hand, and struck the Philistine, and Yahweh worked a great victory for all Israel. You saw it, and rejoiced. Why then will you sin against innocent blood, to kill David without a cause?"

name: 1 Samuel 19:6
text: Saul listened to the voice of Jonathan: and Saul swore, "As Yahweh lives, he shall not be put to death."

name: 1 Samuel 19:7
text: Jonathan called David, and Jonathan showed him all those things. Jonathan brought David to Saul, and he was in his presence, as before.

name: 1 Samuel 19:8
text: There was war again. David went out, and fought with the Philistines, and killed them with a great slaughter; and they fled before him.

name: 1 Samuel 19:9
text: An evil spirit from Yahweh was on Saul, as he sat in his house with his spear in his hand; and David was playing with his hand.

name: 1 Samuel 19:10
text: Saul sought to pin David even to the wall with the spear; but he slipped away out of Saul"s presence, and he stuck the spear into the wall. David fled, and escaped that night.

name: 1 Samuel 19:11
text: Saul sent messengers to David"s house, to watch him, and to kill him in the morning. Michal, David"s wife, told him, saying, "If you don"t save your life tonight, tomorrow you will be killed."

name: 1 Samuel 19:12
text: So Michal let David down through the window. He went, fled, and escaped.

name: 1 Samuel 19:13
text: Michal took the teraphim, and laid it in the bed, and put a pillow of goats" hair at its head, and covered it with the clothes.

name: 1 Samuel 19:14
text: When Saul sent messengers to take David, she said, "He is sick."

name: 1 Samuel 19:15
text: Saul sent the messengers to see David, saying, "Bring him up to me in the bed, that I may kill him."

name: 1 Samuel 19:16
text: When the messengers came in, behold, the teraphim was in the bed, with the pillow of goats" hair at its head.

name: 1 Samuel 19:17
text: Saul said to Michal, "Why have you deceived me thus, and let my enemy go, so that he is escaped?" Michal answered Saul, "He said to me, "Let me go! Why should I kill you?""

name: 1 Samuel 19:18
text: Now David fled, and escaped, and came to Samuel to Ramah, and told him all that Saul had done to him. He and Samuel went and lived in Naioth.

name: 1 Samuel 19:19
text: It was told Saul, saying, "Behold, David is at Naioth in Ramah."

name: 1 Samuel 19:20
text: Saul sent messengers to take David: and when they saw the company of the prophets prophesying, and Samuel standing as head over them, the Spirit of God came on the messengers of Saul, and they also prophesied.

name: 1 Samuel 19:21
text: When it was told Saul, he sent other messengers, and they also prophesied. Saul sent messengers again the third time, and they also prophesied.

name: 1 Samuel 19:22
text: Then went he also to Ramah, and came to the great well that is in Secu: and he asked, "Where are Samuel and David?" One said, "Behold, they are at Naioth in Ramah."

name: 1 Samuel 19:23
text: He went there to Naioth in Ramah. Then the Spirit of God came on him also, and he went on, and prophesied, until he came to Naioth in Ramah.

name: 1 Samuel 19:24
text: He also stripped off his clothes, and he also prophesied before Samuel, and lay down naked all that day and all that night. Therefore they say, "Is Saul also among the prophets?"

name: 1 Samuel 20:1
text: David fled from Naioth in Ramah, and came and said before Jonathan, "What have I done? What is my iniquity? What is my sin before your father, that he seeks my life?"

name: 1 Samuel 20:2
text: He said to him, "Far from it; you shall not die. Behold, my father does nothing either great or small, but that he discloses it to me; and why should my father hide this thing from me? It is not so."

name: 1 Samuel 20:3
text: David swore moreover, and said, "Your father knows well that I have found favor in your eyes; and he says, "Don"t let Jonathan know this, lest he be grieved:" but truly as Yahweh lives, and as your soul lives, there is but a step between me and death."

name: 1 Samuel 20:4
text: Then Jonathan said to David, "Whatever your soul desires, I will even do it for you."

name: 1 Samuel 20:5
text: David said to Jonathan, "Behold, tomorrow is the new moon, and I should not fail to dine with the king; but let me go, that I may hide myself in the field to the third day at evening.

name: 1 Samuel 20:6
text: If your father miss me at all, then say, "David earnestly asked leave of me that he might run to Bethlehem his city; for it is the yearly sacrifice there for all the family."

name: 1 Samuel 20:7
text: If he says, "It is well;" your servant shall have peace: but if he be angry, then know that evil is determined by him.

name: 1 Samuel 20:8
text: Therefore deal kindly with your servant; for you have brought your servant into a covenant of Yahweh with you: but if there is iniquity in me, kill me yourself; for why should you bring me to your father?"

name: 1 Samuel 20:9
text: Jonathan said, "Far be it from you; for if I should at all know that evil were determined by my father to come on you, then wouldn"t I tell you that?"

name: 1 Samuel 20:10
text: Then David said to Jonathan, "Who shall tell me if perchance your father answers you roughly?"

name: 1 Samuel 20:11
text: Jonathan said to David, "Come, and let us go out into the field." They both went out into the field.

name: 1 Samuel 20:12
text: Jonathan said to David, "By Yahweh, the God of Israel, when I have sounded my father about this time tomorrow, or the third day, behold, if there is good toward David, shall I not then send to you, and disclose it to you?

name: 1 Samuel 20:13
text: Yahweh do so to Jonathan, and more also, should it please my father to do you evil, if I don"t disclose it to you, and send you away, that you may go in peace: and Yahweh be with you, as he has been with my father.

name: 1 Samuel 20:14
text: You shall not only while yet I live show me the loving kindness of Yahweh, that I not die;

name: 1 Samuel 20:15
text: but also you shall not cut off your kindness from my house forever; no, not when Yahweh has cut off the enemies of David everyone from the surface of the earth."

name: 1 Samuel 20:16
text: So Jonathan made a covenant with the house of David, saying, "Yahweh will require it at the hand of David"s enemies."

name: 1 Samuel 20:17
text: Jonathan caused David to swear again, for the love that he had to him; for he loved him as he loved his own soul.

name: 1 Samuel 20:18
text: Then Jonathan said to him, "Tomorrow is the new moon: and you will be missed, because your seat will be empty.

name: 1 Samuel 20:19
text: When you have stayed three days, you shall go down quickly, and come to the place where you hid yourself when this started, and shall remain by the stone Ezel.

name: 1 Samuel 20:20
text: I will shoot three arrows on its side, as though I shot at a mark.

name: 1 Samuel 20:21
text: Behold, I will send the boy, saying, "Go, find the arrows!" If I tell the boy, "Behold, the arrows are on this side of you. Take them;" then come; for there is peace to you and no hurt, as Yahweh lives.

name: 1 Samuel 20:22
text: But if I say this to the boy, "Behold, the arrows are beyond you;" then go your way; for Yahweh has sent you away.

name: 1 Samuel 20:23
text: Concerning the matter which you and I have spoken of, behold, Yahweh is between you and me forever."

name: 1 Samuel 20:24
text: So David hid himself in the field: and when the new moon had come, the king sat him down to eat food.

name: 1 Samuel 20:25
text: The king sat on his seat, as at other times, even on the seat by the wall; and Jonathan stood up, and Abner sat by Saul"s side: but David"s place was empty.

name: 1 Samuel 20:26
text: Nevertheless Saul didn"t say anything that day: for he thought, "Something has happened to him. He is not clean. Surely he is not clean."

name: 1 Samuel 20:27
text: It happened on the next day after the new moon, the second day, that David"s place was empty. Saul said to Jonathan his son, "Why doesn"t the son of Jesse come to eat, neither yesterday, nor today?"

name: 1 Samuel 20:28
text: Jonathan answered Saul, "David earnestly asked leave of me to go to Bethlehem.

name: 1 Samuel 20:29
text: He said, "Please let me go, for our family has a sacrifice in the city. My brother has commanded me to be there. Now, if I have found favor in your eyes, please let me go away and see my brothers." Therefore he has not come to the king"s table."

name: 1 Samuel 20:30
text: Then Saul"s anger was kindled against Jonathan, and he said to him, "You son of a perverse rebellious woman, don"t I know that you have chosen the son of Jesse to your own shame, and to the shame of your mother"s nakedness?

name: 1 Samuel 20:31
text: For as long as the son of Jesse lives on the earth, you shall not be established, nor your kingdom. Therefore now send and bring him to me, for he shall surely die!"

name: 1 Samuel 20:32
text: Jonathan answered Saul his father, and said to him, "Why should he be put to death? What has he done?"

name: 1 Samuel 20:33
text: Saul cast his spear at him to strike him. By this Jonathan knew that his father was determined to put David to death.

name: 1 Samuel 20:34
text: So Jonathan arose from the table in fierce anger, and ate no food the second day of the month; for he was grieved for David, because his father had done him shame.

name: 1 Samuel 20:35
text: It happened in the morning, that Jonathan went out into the field at the time appointed with David, and a little boy with him.

name: 1 Samuel 20:36
text: He said to his boy, "Run, find now the arrows which I shoot." As the boy ran, he shot an arrow beyond him.

name: 1 Samuel 20:37
text: When the boy had come to the place of the arrow which Jonathan had shot, Jonathan cried after the boy, and said, "Isn"t the arrow beyond you?"

name: 1 Samuel 20:38
text: Jonathan cried after the boy, "Go fast! Hurry! Don"t delay!" Jonathan"s boy gathered up the arrows, and came to his master.

name: 1 Samuel 20:39
text: But the boy didn"t know anything. Only Jonathan and David knew the matter.

name: 1 Samuel 20:40
text: Jonathan gave his weapons to his boy, and said to him, "Go, carry them to the city."

name: 1 Samuel 20:41
text: As soon as the boy was gone, David arose out of the south, and fell on his face to the ground, and bowed himself three times. They kissed one another, and wept one with another, and David wept the most.

name: 1 Samuel 20:42
text: Jonathan said to David, "Go in peace, because we have both sworn in the name of Yahweh, saying, "Yahweh shall be between me and you, and between my seed and your seed, forever."" He arose and departed; and Jonathan went into the city.

name: 1 Samuel 21:1
text: Then came David to Nob to Ahimelech the priest. Ahimelech came to meet David trembling, and said to him, "Why are you alone, and no man with you?"

name: 1 Samuel 21:2
text: David said to Ahimelech the priest, "The king has commanded me a business, and has said to me, "Let no man know anything of the business about which I send you, and what I have commanded you; and I have appointed the young men to such and such a place."

name: 1 Samuel 21:3
text: Now therefore what is under your hand? Give me five loaves of bread in my hand, or whatever there is present."

name: 1 Samuel 21:4
text: The priest answered David, and said, "There is no common bread under my hand, but there is holy bread; if only the young men have kept themselves from women."

name: 1 Samuel 21:5
text: David answered the priest, and said to him, "Truly, women have been kept from us about these three days. When I came out, the vessels of the young men were holy, though it was but a common journey. How much more then today shall their vessels be holy?"

name: 1 Samuel 21:6
text: So the priest gave him holy bread; for there was no bread there but the show bread, that was taken from before Yahweh, to put hot bread in the day when it was taken away.

name: 1 Samuel 21:7
text: Now a certain man of the servants of Saul was there that day, detained before Yahweh; and his name was Doeg the Edomite, the best of the herdsmen who belonged to Saul.

name: 1 Samuel 21:8
text: David said to Ahimelech, "Isn"t there here under your hand spear or sword? For I have neither brought my sword nor my weapons with me, because the king"s business required haste."

name: 1 Samuel 21:9
text: The priest said, "The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom you killed in the valley of Elah, behold, it is here wrapped in a cloth behind the ephod. If you will take that, take it; for there is no other except that here." David said, "There is none like that. Give it to me."

name: 1 Samuel 21:10
text: David arose, and fled that day for fear of Saul, and went to Achish the king of Gath.

name: 1 Samuel 21:11
text: The servants of Achish said to him, "Isn"t this David the king of the land? Didn"t they sing one to another about him in dances, saying, "Saul has slain his thousands, David his ten thousands?""

name: 1 Samuel 21:12
text: David laid up these words in his heart, and was very afraid of Achish the king of Gath.

name: 1 Samuel 21:13
text: He changed his behavior before them, and pretended to be mad in their hands, and scrabbled on the doors of the gate, and let his spittle fall down on his beard.

name: 1 Samuel 21:14
text: Then Achish said to his servants, "Look, you see the man is mad. Why then have you brought him to me?

name: 1 Samuel 21:15
text: Do I lack madmen, that you have brought this fellow to play the madman in my presence? Shall this fellow come into my house?"

name: 1 Samuel 22:1
text: David therefore departed there, and escaped to the cave of Adullam. When his brothers and all his father"s house heard it, they went down there to him.

name: 1 Samuel 22:2
text: Everyone who was in distress, and everyone who was in debt, and everyone who was discontented, gathered themselves to him; and he became captain over them: and there were with him about four hundred men.

name: 1 Samuel 22:3
text: David went there to Mizpeh of Moab, and he said to the king of Moab, "Please let my father and my mother come out with you, until I know what God will do for me."

name: 1 Samuel 22:4
text: He brought them before the king of Moab; and they lived with him all the while that David was in the stronghold.

name: 1 Samuel 22:5
text: The prophet Gad said to David, "Don"t stay in the stronghold. Depart, and go into the land of Judah." Then David departed, and came into the forest of Hereth.

name: 1 Samuel 22:6
text: Saul heard that David was discovered, and the men who were with him. Now Saul was sitting in Gibeah, under the tamarisk tree in Ramah, with his spear in his hand, and all his servants were standing about him.

name: 1 Samuel 22:7
text: Saul said to his servants who stood about him, "Hear now, you Benjamites! Will the son of Jesse give everyone of you fields and vineyards, will he make you all captains of thousands and captains of hundreds,

name: 1 Samuel 22:8
text: that all of you have conspired against me, and there is none who discloses to me when my son makes a treaty with the son of Jesse, and there is none of you who is sorry for me, or discloses to me that my son has stirred up my servant against me, to lie in wait, as at this day?"

name: 1 Samuel 22:9
text: Then Doeg the Edomite, who stood by the servants of Saul, answered and said, "I saw the son of Jesse coming to Nob, to Ahimelech the son of Ahitub.

name: 1 Samuel 22:10
text: He inquired of Yahweh for him, gave him food, and gave him the sword of Goliath the Philistine."

name: 1 Samuel 22:11
text: Then the king sent to call Ahimelech the priest, the son of Ahitub, and all his father"s house, the priests who were in Nob: and they came all of them to the king.

name: 1 Samuel 22:12
text: Saul said, "Hear now, you son of Ahitub." He answered, "Here I am, my lord."

name: 1 Samuel 22:13
text: Saul said to him, "Why have you conspired against me, you and the son of Jesse, in that you have given him bread, and a sword, and have inquired of God for him, that he should rise against me, to lie in wait, as at this day?"

name: 1 Samuel 22:14
text: Then Ahimelech answered the king, and said, "Who among all your servants is so faithful as David, who is the king"s son-in-law, and is taken into your council, and is honorable in your house?

name: 1 Samuel 22:15
text: Have I today begun to inquire of God for him? Be it far from me! Don"t let the king impute anything to his servant, nor to all the house of my father; for your servant knows nothing of all this, less or more."

name: 1 Samuel 22:16
text: The king said, "You shall surely die, Ahimelech, you, and all your father"s house."

name: 1 Samuel 22:17
text: The king said to the guard who stood about him, "Turn, and kill the priests of Yahweh; because their hand also is with David, and because they knew that he fled, and didn"t disclose it to me." But the servants of the king wouldn"t put forth their hand to fall on the priests of Yahweh.

name: 1 Samuel 22:18
text: The king said to Doeg, "Turn and attack the priests!" Doeg the Edomite turned, and he attacked the priests, and he killed on that day eighty-five people who wore a linen ephod.

name: 1 Samuel 22:19
text: He struck Nob, the city of the priests, with the edge of the sword, both men and women, children and nursing babies, and cattle and donkeys and sheep, with the edge of the sword.

name: 1 Samuel 22:20
text: One of the sons of Ahimelech, the son of Ahitub, named Abiathar, escaped, and fled after David.

name: 1 Samuel 22:21
text: Abiathar told David that Saul had slain Yahweh"s priests.

name: 1 Samuel 22:22
text: David said to Abiathar, "I knew on that day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would surely tell Saul. I am responsible for the death of all the persons of your father"s house.

name: 1 Samuel 22:23
text: Stay with me, don"t be afraid; for he who seeks my life seeks your life. For with me you shall be in safeguard."

name: 1 Samuel 23:1
text: David was told, "Behold, the Philistines are fighting against Keilah, and are robbing the threshing floors."

name: 1 Samuel 23:2
text: Therefore David inquired of Yahweh, saying, "Shall I go and strike these Philistines?" Yahweh said to David, "Go strike the Philistines, and save Keilah."

name: 1 Samuel 23:3
text: David"s men said to him, "Behold, we are afraid here in Judah: how much more then if we go to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?"

name: 1 Samuel 23:4
text: Then David inquired of Yahweh yet again. Yahweh answered him, and said, "Arise, go down to Keilah; for I will deliver the Philistines into your hand."

name: 1 Samuel 23:5
text: David and his men went to Keilah, and fought with the Philistines, and brought away their livestock, and killed them with a great slaughter. So David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.

name: 1 Samuel 23:6
text: It happened, when Abiathar the son of Ahimelech fled to David to Keilah, that he came down with an ephod in his hand.

name: 1 Samuel 23:7
text: It was told Saul that David had come to Keilah. Saul said, "God has delivered him into my hand; for he is shut in, by entering into a town that has gates and bars."

name: 1 Samuel 23:8
text: Saul summoned all the people to war, to go down to Keilah, to besiege David and his men.

name: 1 Samuel 23:9
text: David knew that Saul was devising mischief against him; and he said to Abiathar the priest, "Bring the ephod here."

name: 1 Samuel 23:10
text: Then David said, "O Yahweh, the God of Israel, your servant has surely heard that Saul seeks to come to Keilah, to destroy the city for my sake.

name: 1 Samuel 23:11
text: Will the men of Keilah deliver me up into his hand? Will Saul come down, as your servant has heard? Yahweh, the God of Israel, I beg you, tell your servant." Yahweh said, "He will come down."

name: 1 Samuel 23:12
text: Then David said, "Will the men of Keilah deliver me and my men into the hand of Saul?" Yahweh said, "They will deliver you up."

name: 1 Samuel 23:13
text: Then David and his men, who were about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah, and went wherever they could go. It was told Saul that David was escaped from Keilah; and he gave up going there.

name: 1 Samuel 23:14
text: David stayed in the wilderness in the strongholds, and remained in the hill country in the wilderness of Ziph. Saul sought him every day, but God didn"t deliver him into his hand.

name: 1 Samuel 23:15
text: David saw that Saul had come out to seek his life. David was in the wilderness of Ziph in the wood.

name: 1 Samuel 23:16
text: Jonathan, Saul"s son, arose, and went to David into the woods, and strengthened his hand in God.

name: 1 Samuel 23:17
text: He said to him, "Don"t be afraid; for the hand of Saul my father shall not find you; and you shall be king over Israel, and I shall be next to you; and that also Saul my father knows."

name: 1 Samuel 23:18
text: They both made a covenant before Yahweh: and David stayed in the woods, and Jonathan went to his house.

name: 1 Samuel 23:19
text: Then the Ziphites came up to Saul to Gibeah, saying, "Doesn"t David hide himself with us in the strongholds in the wood, in the hill of Hachilah, which is on the south of the desert?

name: 1 Samuel 23:20
text: Now therefore, O king, come down, according to all the desire of your soul to come down; and our part shall be to deliver him up into the king"s hand."

name: 1 Samuel 23:21
text: Saul said, "You are blessed by Yahweh; for you have had compassion on me.

name: 1 Samuel 23:22
text: Please go make yet more sure, and know and see his place where his haunt is, and who has seen him there; for it is told me that he deals very subtly.

name: 1 Samuel 23:23
text: See therefore, and take knowledge of all the lurking places where he hides himself, and come again to me with certainty, and I will go with you: and it shall happen, if he is in the land, that I will search him out among all the thousands of Judah."

name: 1 Samuel 23:24
text: They arose, and went to Ziph before Saul: but David and his men were in the wilderness of Maon, in the Arabah on the south of the desert.

name: 1 Samuel 23:25
text: Saul and his men went to seek him. When David was told, he went down to the rock, and stayed in the wilderness of Maon. When Saul heard that, he pursued David in the wilderness of Maon.

name: 1 Samuel 23:26
text: Saul went on this side of the mountain, and David and his men on that side of the mountain: and David made haste to get away for fear of Saul; for Saul and his men surrounded David and his men to take them.

name: 1 Samuel 23:27
text: But a messenger came to Saul, saying, "Hurry and come; for the Philistines have made a raid on the land!"

name: 1 Samuel 23:28
text: So Saul returned from pursuing after David, and went against the Philistines: therefore they called that place Sela Hammahlekoth.

name: 1 Samuel 23:29
text: David went up from there, and lived in the strongholds of En Gedi.

name: 1 Samuel 24:1
text: It happened, when Saul was returned from following the Philistines, that it was told him, saying, "Behold, David is in the wilderness of En Gedi."

name: 1 Samuel 24:2
text: Then Saul took three thousand chosen men out of all Israel, and went to seek David and his men on the rocks of the wild goats.

name: 1 Samuel 24:3
text: He came to the sheep pens by the way, where there was a cave; and Saul went in to relieve himself. Now David and his men were abiding in the innermost parts of the cave.

name: 1 Samuel 24:4
text: The men of David said to him, "Behold, the day of which Yahweh said to you, "Behold, I will deliver your enemy into your hand, and you shall do to him as it shall seem good to you."" Then David arose, and cut off the skirt of Saul"s robe secretly.

name: 1 Samuel 24:5
text: It happened afterward, that David"s heart struck him, because he had cut off Saul"s skirt.

name: 1 Samuel 24:6
text: He said to his men, "Yahweh forbid that I should do this thing to my lord, Yahweh"s anointed, to put forth my hand against him, since he is Yahweh"s anointed."

name: 1 Samuel 24:7
text: So David checked his men with these words, and didn"t allow them to rise against Saul. Saul rose up out of the cave, and went on his way.

name: 1 Samuel 24:8
text: David also arose afterward, and went out of the cave, and cried after Saul, saying, "My lord the king!" When Saul looked behind him, David bowed with his face to the earth, and showed respect.

name: 1 Samuel 24:9
text: David said to Saul, "Why do you listen to men"s words, saying, "Behold, David seeks your hurt?"

name: 1 Samuel 24:10
text: Behold, this day your eyes have seen how that Yahweh had delivered you today into my hand in the cave. Some urged me to kill you; but I spared you; and I said, I will not put forth my hand against my lord; for he is Yahweh"s anointed.

name: 1 Samuel 24:11
text: Moreover, my father, behold, yes, see the skirt of your robe in my hand; for in that I cut off the skirt of your robe, and didn"t kill you, know and see that there is neither evil nor disobedience in my hand, and I have not sinned against you, though you hunt for my life to take it.

name: 1 Samuel 24:12
text: May Yahweh judge between me and you, and may Yahweh avenge me of you; but my hand shall not be on you.

name: 1 Samuel 24:13
text: As the proverb of the ancients says, "Out of the wicked comes forth wickedness;" but my hand shall not be on you.

name: 1 Samuel 24:14
text: Against whom has the king of Israel come out? Whom do you pursue? A dead dog? A flea?

name: 1 Samuel 24:15
text: May Yahweh therefore be judge, and give sentence between me and you, and see, and plead my cause, and deliver me out of your hand."

name: 1 Samuel 24:16
text: It came to pass, when David had made an end of speaking these words to Saul, that Saul said, "Is this your voice, my son David?" Saul lifted up his voice, and wept.

name: 1 Samuel 24:17
text: He said to David, "You are more righteous than I; for you have done good to me, whereas I have done evil to you.

name: 1 Samuel 24:18
text: You have declared this day how you have dealt well with me, because when Yahweh had delivered me up into your hand, you didn"t kill me.

name: 1 Samuel 24:19
text: For if a man finds his enemy, will he let him go away unharmed? Therefore may Yahweh reward you good for that which you have done to me this day.

name: 1 Samuel 24:20
text: Now, behold, I know that you shall surely be king, and that the kingdom of Israel shall be established in your hand.

name: 1 Samuel 24:21
text: Swear now therefore to me by Yahweh, that you will not cut off my seed after me, and that you will not destroy my name out of my father"s house."

name: 1 Samuel 24:22
text: David swore to Saul. Saul went home; but David and his men went up to the stronghold.

name: 1 Samuel 25:1
text: Samuel died; and all Israel gathered themselves together, and lamented him, and buried him in his house at Ramah. David arose, and went down to the wilderness of Paran.

name: 1 Samuel 25:2
text: There was a man in Maon, whose possessions were in Carmel; and the man was very great, and he had three thousand sheep, and a thousand goats: and he was shearing his sheep in Carmel.

name: 1 Samuel 25:3
text: Now the name of the man was Nabal; and the name of his wife Abigail; and the woman was of good understanding, and of a beautiful face: but the man was churlish and evil in his doings; and he was of the house of Caleb.

name: 1 Samuel 25:4
text: David heard in the wilderness that Nabal was shearing his sheep.

name: 1 Samuel 25:5
text: David sent ten young men, and David said to the young men, "Go up to Carmel, and go to Nabal, and greet him in my name.

name: 1 Samuel 25:6
text: You shall tell him, "Long life to you! Peace be to you, and peace be to your house, and peace be to all that you have.

name: 1 Samuel 25:7
text: Now I have heard that you have shearers. Your shepherds have now been with us, and we didn"t hurt them, neither was there anything missing from them, all the while they were in Carmel.

name: 1 Samuel 25:8
text: Ask your young men, and they will tell you. Therefore, let the young men find favor in your eyes; for we come in a good day. Please give whatever comes to your hand, to your servants, and to your son David.""

name: 1 Samuel 25:9
text: When David"s young men came, they spoke to Nabal according to all those words in the name of David, and ceased.

name: 1 Samuel 25:10
text: Nabal answered David"s servants, and said, "Who is David? Who is the son of Jesse? There are many servants who break away from their masters these days.

name: 1 Samuel 25:11
text: Shall I then take my bread, and my water, and my meat that I have killed for my shearers, and give it to men who I don"t know where they come from?"

name: 1 Samuel 25:12
text: So David"s young men turned on their way, and went back, and came and told him according to all these words.

name: 1 Samuel 25:13
text: David said to his men, "Every man put on his sword!" Every man put on his sword. David also put on his sword. About four hundred men followed David; and two hundred stayed by the baggage.

name: 1 Samuel 25:14
text: But one of the young men told Abigail, Nabal"s wife, saying, "Behold, David sent messengers out of the wilderness to Greet our master; and he railed at them.

name: 1 Samuel 25:15
text: But the men were very good to us, and we were not hurt, neither missed we anything, as long as we went with them, when we were in the fields.

name: 1 Samuel 25:16
text: They were a wall to us both by night and by day, all the while we were with them keeping the sheep.

name: 1 Samuel 25:17
text: Now therefore know and consider what you will do; for evil is determined against our master, and against all his house; for he is such a worthless fellow that one can"t speak to him."

name: 1 Samuel 25:18
text: Then Abigail hurried and took two hundred loaves of bread, two bottles of wine, five sheep ready dressed, five measures of parched grain, one hundred clusters of raisins, and two hundred cakes of figs, and laid them on donkeys.

name: 1 Samuel 25:19
text: She said to her young men, "Go on before me. Behold, I come after you." But she didn"t tell her husband, Nabal.

name: 1 Samuel 25:20
text: It was so, as she rode on her donkey, and came down by the covert of the mountain, that behold, David and his men came down toward her; and she met them.

name: 1 Samuel 25:21
text: Now David had said, "Surely in vain have I kept all that this fellow has in the wilderness, so that nothing was missed of all that pertained to him. He has returned me evil for good.

name: 1 Samuel 25:22
text: God do so to the enemies of David, and more also, if I leave of all that belongs to him by the morning light so much as one who urinates on a wall."

name: 1 Samuel 25:23
text: When Abigail saw David, she hurried, and alighted from her donkey, and fell before David on her face, and bowed herself to the ground.

name: 1 Samuel 25:24
text: She fell at his feet, and said, "On me, my lord, on me be the iniquity; and please let your handmaid speak in your ears. Hear the words of your handmaid.

name: 1 Samuel 25:25
text: Please don"t let my lord regard this worthless fellow, even Nabal; for as his name is, so is he. Nabal is his name, and folly is with him; but I, your handmaid, didn"t see the young men of my lord, whom you sent.

name: 1 Samuel 25:26
text: Now therefore, my lord, as Yahweh lives, and as your soul lives, since Yahweh has withheld you from blood guiltiness, and from avenging yourself with your own hand, now therefore let your enemies, and those who seek evil to my lord, be as Nabal.

name: 1 Samuel 25:27
text: Now this present which your servant has brought to my lord, let it be given to the young men who follow my lord.

name: 1 Samuel 25:28
text: Please forgive the trespass of your handmaid. For Yahweh will certainly make my lord a sure house, because my lord fights the battles of Yahweh; and evil shall not be found in you all your days.

name: 1 Samuel 25:29
text: Though men may rise up to pursue you, and to seek your soul, yet the soul of my lord shall be bound in the bundle of life with Yahweh your God. He will sling out the souls of your enemies, as from the hollow of a sling.

name: 1 Samuel 25:30
text: It shall come to pass, when Yahweh has done to my lord according to all the good that he has spoken concerning you, and shall have appointed you prince over Israel,

name: 1 Samuel 25:31
text: that this shall be no grief to you, nor offense of heart to my lord, either that you have shed blood without cause, or that my lord has avenged himself. When Yahweh has dealt well with my lord, then remember your handmaid."

name: 1 Samuel 25:32
text: David said to Abigail, "Blessed is Yahweh, the God of Israel, who sent you this day to meet me!

name: 1 Samuel 25:33
text: Blessed is your discretion, and blessed are you, that have kept me this day from blood guiltiness, and from avenging myself with my own hand.

name: 1 Samuel 25:34
text: For indeed, as Yahweh, the God of Israel, lives, who has withheld me from hurting you, unless you had hurried and come to meet me, surely there wouldn"t have been left to Nabal by the morning light so much as one who urinates on a wall."
